text: Ukraine can win, & it will win if we provide Ukraine with the tools that it needs. If we falter, we lose time—delay could mean defeat.
As I urged on the Senate floor, the President should send ATACMS—now. Such action would speak volumes. And support for the $24 billion supplemental is imperative—now.

Thank you @LauraLThornton for sharing your family’s gut-wrenching experience & for emphasizing the need for the Kids Online Safety Act. Congress needs to act swiftly to provide young people & parents the tools & safeguards so urgently needed.

Glad to see DOD spearheading creative initiatives to address Ukraine’s munitions shortages. All innovative ideas should be on the table to get Ukrainians the supplies that they urgently need. cnn.com/2023/10/04/politics/…

Throughout her stellar career—as a teacher, public defender, & clinic head—upholding the rule of law has been her life’s work. She has earned esteem from opposing litigants as well as allies, including prosecutors, judges & defense attorneys. I’ll push for her swift confirmation.

Sarah Russell has been a relentless champion of justice—making legal rights real for countless people needing an advocate, & giving voice to the voiceless & most vulnerable. In both the courtroom & classroom, she has led by example. ctmirror.org/2023/10/04/quin…

Republicans need to end the chaos, & get back to the work of governing on behalf of the American people. We need to fund the government beyond 45 days, fight the fentanyl epidemic, & help our Ukrainian allies defeat Vladimir Putin. We have work to do.
Democracy’s challenge: rebut & reject Putin’s powerful disinformation campaign seeking to dislodge support for Ukraine. It’s no less dangerous for being obvious.
Approving a major Ukraine supplemental is an urgent imperative—a must do, right now. It can’t be bogged down in draconian immigration policy restrictions.
McCarthy needs to do his job—reject the handful of hard right extremists, again support a bipartisan solution & serve the nation’s best interest.

We can avoid more chaos & confusion with continuing shutdown threats by urgently adopting 12 Senate appropriations bills—approved in overwhelming bipartisan votes in the Appropriations Committee. They implement the agreement already reached in the debt ceiling extension.

She was always full of encouragement & warmth no matter how difficult the cause or challenge, & her smiling, steadfast courage & strength will always inspire me. My thoughts are with her family, friends, & colleagues who will miss her dearly. 3/3
I was proud to work with Senator Feinstein on issues that she championed tirelessly over decades, like gun violence prevention & civil liberties protection—she never backed down. 2/
I will always remember Senator Feinstein with deep admiration & affection as a smart, strong leader & legislator as well as a thoughtful, sweet friend. 1/

23 years ago today the FDA approved mifepristone. Now this safe, effective, decades-old medication is under serious attack—possibly further restricting abortion access. Judges & politicians should not be making personal family planning decisions for millions of Americans.

Amazon has richly earned this enforcement action—along with the riches it’s earned with its illegal practices that raise prices & undercut competitors. A court should order it to stop misusing its monopolistic power, or break up its monopoly. washingtonpost.com/technolog…

During the pandemic CT’s breweries were hard hit. Glad to see these local businesses bouncing back & being nationally recognized for the unique, quality beverages they are producing. ctinsider.com/living/food/ar…
Yesterday I got my COVID & flu shots at CVS. Protect yourself as well as others from the needless & preventable pain & suffering of these diseases with safe & effective vaccines.
Deeply honored to receive the Silver Eagle Award from Scottish Rite Freemasons at Annual Dinner in Wallingford. Masons are a paragon of good fellowship & good works.
Congratulations to Nancy DiNardo—Grand Marshal of Bridgeport’s Columbus Day Parade—honored this weekend for her tireless public service.

Congress should include funding for Ukraine in the CR, an absolutely crucial starting step toward the $24 billion supplemental. Face to face in the old Senate chamber, President Zelenskyy told us how desperately Ukraine needs it. We can’t face ourselves, or the world, if we fail.

Honoring former state Supreme Court Justice Lubbie Harper yesterday in Stratford at the Ruby & Calvin Fletcher African American History Museum is a huge privilege. He has a powerful mind, a big heart, & a passion for justice.

On their last day at Top Dog, Andrea & Alan Spaulding were serving long lines of devoted fans of all ages with famous hot dogs & topping. Bittersweet moment as they turn the counter over to Marissa Puida.

A new High School in New Fairfield—alive with natural light & air, but designed to promote solid education basics. Thanks for the great model of a community coming together—getting results on time, within budget.

Let’s hope Justice Kagan’s call for a Supreme Court Code of Ethics is a sign—perhaps a judicial trial balloon—that Chief Justice Roberts will finally lead his brethren there. He can help save the Court from continuing self-inflicted ignominy. nytimes.com/2023/09/22/us/su…

Listening to Pres. Zelenskyy yesterday, there’s no excuse for further delay in sending ATACMS—long range artillery set to make a life & death difference. Military leaders say we need them for our stockpile, send them to Ukraine, now. washingtonpost.com/national-…
MBS says the quiet part out loud—he’ll “continue sportswashing”. That’s why I’ll continue investigating. nbcsports.com/golf/news/crow…
No end to the disgrace—except for Congress to act. Now. A code of ethics is imperative, for the Court’s & America’s sake.

My colleagues & I have pushed for the creation of this office through legislation. Legislation is still necessary to assure this new office the power & permanence it needs, in case another president has different views.

An Office on Gun Violence Prevention is a major step forward in our fight against this deadly epidemic. This new office will provide a central point of leadership to concentrate resources & bring together survivors, law enforcement, experts, & policymakers.reuters.com/world/us/biden-e…
President Zelenskyy’s powerful, heartfelt message: We are strong & unified, you must be too. We are deeply thankful. “You gave money, we gave lives.”

Having worked with Vernon Oliver, I know firsthand that he has a strong mind, a big heart, & a passion for justice. He’s exactly the kind of jurist & public servant we need on the federal bench. I commend President Biden & my colleagues for this eminently qualified nominee.

Wonderful to be at the Wallingford Station to kick off #RailSafetyWeek. Tremendous work has been done to improve our railways, but more must be done to stop catastrophes, derailments, & other serious injuries.
Happy 76th birthday @usairforce! Thank you to all the brave, courageous airmen & women for your commitment to keeping our skies—& country—safe.
Proud of my colleagues in the House for fighting to force a vote on Ethan’s Law. This lifesaving legislation will help ensure that guns are safely stored—preventing heartbreaking tragedies.
I share their relief that his serious medical condition may now be treated, & his well-deserved liberty & rights have been restored.

I am relieved that Morad Tahbaz is now free after many long years of unspeakably cruel, inexcusable imprisonment. Morad’s release is a testament to the courage & strength of his family & supporters, who never surrendered fighting for his freedom. nytimes.com/2023/09/18/us/po…
A happy, healthy New Year to all celebrating #RoshHashanah. May the year be blessed with peace & love. Shana Tova.

The 81,000 brave servicemembers who remain missing & unaccounted for are not forgotten. On National POW/MIA Recognition Day, we recognize their sacrifice & redouble our promise to keep working to bring them home.

This #HispanicHeritageMonth, let’s celebrate & honor the profound impact that Hispanics have in shaping the past, present, & future of our country. Through the community’s diverse culture & contributions, America is made a stronger & more vibrant nation.

We are in the middle of a recruiting crisis & the MHS Genesis system is making it exponentially more difficult to join the military. Young people who want to serve our nation shouldn’t have to wait months to begin training because of an inefficient system. militarytimes.com/news/your-…

This fantastic news for CT is a testament to the world class airmen & women at Bradley Air National Guard Base. This top notch facility, will be a perfect home for the C-130J. af.mil/News/Article-Display/…

The Saudi’s Public Investment Fund cannot have it both ways: if it wants to engage with the US commercially, it must be subject to US law & oversight. 

Today I am issuing a subpoena for documents related to PIF's takeover of American golf & other US investments.

HAPPENING NOW: My Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations examines Saudi Arabian Public Investment Fund’s investments & influence efforts in the US & the implications for the PGA Tour - LIV deal. https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1OdKrzOzvokKX

LIVE: As we move forward with a framework for sensible guardrails on AI, we need a full & fair airing of the dangers as well as tremendous promise. Today we hear from top industry executives & leading experts who will help inform this legislation. https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1jMJgLRpXdqxL

On 9/11 we remember the horror & heroism of that tragic day 22 years ago. We must never forget the 2,977 lives we lost in the attack & the thousands more whose lives were forever changed by that fateful day. We will continue to honor their memory.

Republicans seeking to stop Ukraine aid risk reaping the whirlwind—American troops embroiled in bloody battle after Putin murderously occupies Ukraine & makes a NATO ally his next victim. Stop him now—or stop him later, at far greater cost. washingtonpost.com/national-…
Muggy, sweltering summer’s end weather—but the Bethlehem Fair is always a treat. Thanks for all the hard work that makes it possible.

Congratulations to Beth Coyne on becoming head of school at Laurelton Hall. She’s an extraordinary educator! Her leadership marks a new exciting chapter for this magnificent girls school, whose graduates contribute so much through community service & fulfill its values & ideals.

The arrogance seems unabated. Time is long overdue for colleagues to blow the whistle on Justice Alito. Leadership by Chief Justice Roberts is abundantly necessary to stop rogue wrongdoing & support a Code of Conduct.
nytimes.com/2023/09/08/us/po…
License requirements, clear AI identification, accountability, transparency, & strong protections for consumers & kids—such commonsense principles are a solid starting point.
We’ll continue hearings with industry leaders & experts, as well as other conversations & fact finding to build a coalition of support for legislation.

This bipartisan framework is a milestone—the first tough, comprehensive legislative blueprint for real, enforceable AI protections. It should put us on a path to addressing the promise & peril AI portends.

Big Pharma is abusing our patent system to stifle innovation & keep costs high—leaving patients footing the bill & living with the consequences. We need my & @JohnCornyn’s Affordable Prescriptions for Patients Act to help fix this deeply broken system. nytimes.com/2023/09/07/podca…

Officer Bobby Garten answered the call late last night to protect public safety & made the ultimate sacrifice. My prayers are with his family & the entire @HartfordPolice Department on this tragic day. wtnh.com/news/connecticut/ha…

The air raid sirens that marked Sec. Blinken’s visit—& that I heard just 2 weeks ago—show the everyday danger & destruction endured by Ukrainians & the critical need for more air defense as well as F-16 aircraft, artillery, munitions, armored vehicles, drones, etc.

As was clear in my own recent Kyiv visit, the arms committed by Sec. Blinken are critical to continuing Ukraine’s steady success in combat, both east & south. Congress now must do its job in approving $24 billion in supplemental aid. nytimes.com/live/2023/09/06/…

Enjoyed an amazingly delicious sub at Lucia’s Salumeria right after the Newtown Labor Day Parade on Monday. Everything fresh, everyone gracious.
newtownbee.com/05222023/luci…

Newtown’s annual Labor Day Parade celebrated again the dignity of work & dedication of American workers—with exuberance & excitement to mark the end of summer. Thanks for this immensely inspiring organizational triumph.
Odyssey Festival at St. Barbara’s Church in Orange celebrated Greek heritage, culture, & faith—unimaginably great food, entertainment & people.

Bridgewater’s Annual Tractor Parade is a unique, heartwarming celebration of community, with the incomparable honor of driving a tractor every year. Rain or shine (this year was all shine) it’s a spectacular show of tractors, floats, great food, music, & wonderful people.
At the Goshen Fair with Jane & her Dad, & their prize winning steer. Something for everyone here—fair food, music, farm exhibits, wine tasting & much more. Folks from all over are loving it.

On #LaborDay, & every day, we owe hardworking Americans our deepest gratitude. I’ll keep fighting to better workplace safety, skills training, health care, & more to grow & support our stellar workforce.

We must stop the spread of the Spotted Laternfly before it wreaks havoc on our state’s ecosystems & agriculture. I’m proud to support legislation to make grants available for critical research to mitigate the proliferation of this invasive species.

Homelessness is careening toward a winter crisis—as housing shortages combine with an end to the eviction moratorium & COVID aid to create a perfect storm. I join colleagues in urging emergency relief in the President’s supplemental proposal.

This forced clean-up effort does nothing to clear Justice Thomas. Back dating disclosures, in some instances by decades, shows the real rot of benefits & luxuries he’s received because of his position of power. The Supreme Court needs a binding code of ethics—now.
Peter Salovey is a great champion for Yale University & the New Haven community. His advocacy for academic excellence & community engagement will be deeply missed.

Sharon Hospital must continue labor & delivery service—as advocates have insisted & the Office of Health Strategy has now ruled. Nuvance should accept that decision, not appeal it, or put profits over patients, forcing long dangerous travel.

The New Heights Child Development Program is providing excellent, quality child care. Investing in child care is an investment in our kids’ future, working parents, & the economy. I’ll keep fighting for legislation to better support child care facilities & cap costs for families.

Because of the Inflation Reduction Act, Medicare can finally negotiate lower costs for popular prescription drugs for the first time ever. These new deals will result in real savings—making health care more affordable for millions of Americans. cnn.com/2023/08/29/politics/…

Keeping passengers stranded on airport tarmacs & trapped aboard grounded planes is absolutely unacceptable. This fine begins to hold American Airlines accountable for these repeated violations of the law. DOT action is critical to protect consumers.
Ukraine needs more arms, more aid and more support if they’re going to win this war. Our bipartisan message is: we are committed to providing Ukraine with the tools needs to win this fight.
When I was in Kyiv, I told President Zelenskyy about some of Ukraine’s staunchest&strongest supporters at home in Connecticut. Proud to stand with them today.
Perfect day for the Chester Fair— the only “No Waste” fair in CT. Thanks to all who worked so hard to make this community event a spectacular success.

Firearms & violent extremism—spurring tragic shootings in Jacksonville—are a toxic combination that must be condemned & rooted out. Gunmen fueled by white supremacy are a metastasizing evil—one of the biggest threats to our nation’s internal security.
Congratulations to India for the remarkable success of the Chandrayaan-3 mission. An incredible achievement & step forward for space exploration.

Next, I’ll be traveling to Brussels with @SenWarren to meet with NATO leadership, members of the European Parliament, & the U.S. Mission to the EU. Strengthening the transatlantic alliance is critical to safeguarding our security & ensuring ongoing support for Ukraine.

We must work to increase our & our allies’, including Ukraine’s, industrial capacity in munitions & other material. Matching our words with bold, decisive actions will keep Ukraine on its path to victory.

We must fully enforce our sanctions regime in light of evidence of violations by American companies & others. We must designate Russia as a state sponsor of terrorism & the Wagner Group a Foreign Terrorist Organization.

It may be slow going & difficult, which we knew it would be, but it is solid, steady progress with a real prospect of significant breakthrough. This is a crucial moment. We must extend lend-lease & quickly pass a bold, bipartisan supplemental security package.

Putin will not stop with Ukraine & failure would only embolden our adversaries. Ukraine needs F-16s with well-trained pilots immediately & longer-range artillery like ATACMS to capitalize on the steady gains of the Ukrainian counter-offensive.

I joined @LindseyGrahamSC & @SenWarren in Kyiv to bring a strong bipartisan message of U.S. & allied support to President Zelenskyy & senior members of his government. Ukraine’s fight for democracy & freedom against an unprovoked Russian invasion is our fight.

Forty-three states—red, purple, & blue—& Congress have all passed some form of this prohibitor with the same objective: keeping domestic violence survivors and their family members alive. There is absolutely no sane legal argument for striking down this law.

Domestic violence restraining orders prohibiting gun possession are neither a novel nor partisan idea—they are a straightforward legal tool to protect survivors when abusers are most dangerous. 

Our amicus brief with 169 colleagues opposes the Fifth Circuit's ruling in Rahimi.

Our nation’s defense depends on highly complex tech products made by great companies like General Digital—celebrating 50 years today. It helps assure our military is second to none, & our service men & women never have a “fair fight.”

Alleged Saudi atrocities & war crimes against Ethiopians should add to second thoughts of potential Saudi partners—the PGA Golf Tour, U.S. government, & others. Partners of this regime should be judged by their actions, clear eyed about apparent blood on Saudi hands.
A national treasure—The Kate in Old Saybrook—last night honored Candice Bergen with the 8th Annual Spirit of Katherine Hepburn Award. Excited & proud to join a full house of fans & supporters.
Bridgewater Fair was bursting with fun, great food & wonderful crowds—on a perfect CT summer day. A magnificent town! Looking forward to the Tractor Parade.

Magnificent, moving Ukrainian Independence Day Concert in Stamford organized by Blue Sky Ukraine. Proud & honored to stand with Ukraine with a wonderful Ukrainian American community at the packed Palace Theatre. Glory to Ukraine!

History made at the Red Cross, as blood donation opportunities are expanded for the LGBTQ+ community. Excited & proud to visit the Wethersfield Community Center, having urged the FDA to eliminate discriminatory restrictions.
Sun shining for the Hamburg Fair after brutal winds & rain yesterday. One of CT’s best with great food, music, hay bale tossing & other entertainment & lots more. Really spectacular people too.
An enlightening, inspiring visit to the Sikh Gallery in Norwich—home to faith, art, culture, education, & much more. A gathering point for a wonderful community.

Microplastics are a macro problem—impacting our health & environment as these tiny particles accumulate. That’s why I’m demanding strong federal steps to stop buying single use plastics & other measures.

Mental health screening really works— saving lives—as shown by Klingberg & CT Council of Family Service Agencies. Their record of success should be a model for other programs as kids go back to school.

Continued shortages of necessary & often used medications are a serious indictment of our nation's drug manufacturing & distribution system. I’ve helped to lead the Drug Shortages Prevention & Quality Improvement Act to increase the available stock of these vital medicines.

PIF can’t have it both ways: if it wants to engage with the US commercially, it must be subject to US law & oversight. That oversight includes the work of my Subcommittee. I’m continuing my inquiry into Saudi Arabia’s influence campaign with letters to Gov. Al-Rumayyan & others.
Extreme judges are yet again seeking to restrict the freedom of doctors & prescribers who want to provide reproductive care & every patient who seeks to receive it.
Make no mistake: the Fifth Circuit may not be as monstrously misguided as the District Court, but it is still wrong on the law, wrong on the science, & a danger to women seeking health care.
This decision has NO immediate impact on access to medication abortion, which remains legal, but it does show that the danger to women’s health care is unabated.

1 year ago we took action to reduce costs for hardworking Americans & invest in solutions to tackle the climate crisis. The Inflation Reduction Act is only the beginning of Democrats’ work to grow the economy from the middle out & bottom up while building a clean energy future.

Putin will not stop with Ukraine & failure would only embolden our adversaries. Ukraine needs F-16s with well-trained pilots immediately & longer-range artillery like ATACMS to capitalize on the steady gains of the Ukrainian counter-offensive.

I joined @LindseyGrahamSC & @SenWarren in Kyiv to bring a strong bipartisan message of U.S. & allied support to President Zelenskyy & senior members of his government. Ukraine’s fight for democracy & freedom against an unprovoked Russian invasion is our fight.

Bridgewater Fair was bursting with fun, great food & wonderful crowds—on a perfect CT summer day. A magnificent town! Looking forward to the Tractor Parade.

Magnificent, moving Ukrainian Independence Day Concert in Stamford organized by Blue Sky Ukraine. Proud & honored to stand with Ukraine with a wonderful Ukrainian American community at the packed Palace Theatre. Glory to Ukraine!

History made at the Red Cross, as blood donation opportunities are expanded for the LGBTQ+ community. Excited & proud to visit the Wethersfield Community Center, having urged the FDA to eliminate discriminatory restrictions.
Sun shining for the Hamburg Fair after brutal winds & rain yesterday. One of CT’s best with great food, music, hay bale tossing & other entertainment & lots more. Really spectacular people too.
An enlightening, inspiring visit to the Sikh Gallery in Norwich—home to faith, art, culture, education, & much more. A gathering point for a wonderful community.

This decision has NO immediate impact on access to medication abortion, which remains legal, but it does show that the danger to women’s health care is unabated.

1 year ago we took action to reduce costs for hardworking Americans & invest in solutions to tackle the climate crisis. The Inflation Reduction Act is only the beginning of Democrats’ work to grow the economy from the middle out & bottom up while building a clean energy future.

Firefighters are saving lives every day. It is only right that we provide them with the best equipment to do their job safely. Proud to be in Colchester to announce a $146,000 federal grant to help make sure that engine exhaust fumes are better ventilated from the fire station.

The Afghan Adjustment Act is a moral imperative for this country to provide permanent status to our Afghan allies who aided our mission & fled after the Taliban’s takeover. These men & women, & their children, should be guaranteed stability & certainty in the US.

We are fighting a vaping & nicotine epidemic. There has been a 47% increase in the number of teens using vaping products over the past 2 years. I’ll be re-introducing the PROTECT Act to equip the CDC with tools to protect young people from the vaping & tobacco industry.
No one is above the law. This rubric of our democracy is now given real life meaning. Our justice system can use this moment to show its transcendent worth.

These serious, incisive criminal charges were brought by a grand jury of everyday Americans, & Donald Trump will be tried by a jury of everyday Americans following the facts & law. Not by any Administration official or politician or media outlet. nytimes.com/live/2023/08/14/…
I’m urging all veterans exposed to toxins during service to take advantage of PACT Act benefits. Learn more at VA.gov/PACT.
Spectacular stars at the Puerto Rican Festival of New Haven—with wonderful crowds, music, food, & more. CT’s Puerto Rican community is the best. Viva Puerto Rico!
Celebrating on the Niantic River—at Save the River Save the Hills 19th Annual Kayak Regatta. A special moving tribute to Fred Grimsey, environmental champion of preserving the Oswegatchie Hills.

Cars can become death traps for young kids in minutes on hot days—but they can be protected by requiring technology, as I’ve advocated, that’s affordable & readily available. These deaths are totally preventable tragedies. nytimes.com/2023/08/10/us/ho…

Kids are going back to school amidst a teacher shortage crisis. I’m backing strong federal measures to recruit & retain these essential educators—more resources for college training, more tax benefits for higher compensation, & more loan forgiveness to cut college debt.

Western delays are inexcusable. Ukrainian troops have repeatedly shown how adept they are at training on the most sophisticated weapons. We must do everything we can to speed F-16s to the battlefield. Anything less slows the counter-offensive. washingtonpost.com/world/202…
Congratulations to all these Hartford Public High School graduates on becoming Hartford Promise Scholars. The diverse talent in this room will undoubtedly make our state better & stronger.

A new house of care to offer clothes & games & other meaningful resources for families receiving DCF services. The Olive Branch Shop will provide critical goods with dignity—allowing families to access help.

Decisive approval of a bold bipartisan supplemental will dispel Putin’s delusions about Ukraine fatigue. He’s counting on democracies becoming discouraged or distracted—so far unfounded. I’ll advocate vehemently, undeterred by difficult Russian defense. washingtonpost.com/business/…

While I am thrilled Morad Tahbaz has been released from Evin Prison, I still unequivocally demand his release to the US & the arms of his family. Despite moving to house arrest, Morad remains wrongfully detained & I will not rest until he is finally freed. nytimes.com/2023/08/10/us/po…

The height of hypocrisy, Justice Thomas’ consistent violation of norms & ethics knows no bounds. This unprecedented flow of luxuries—flights, yacht cruises, expensive sporting tickets—flouts the independence of our judiciary. We need accountability & a SCOTUS code of ethics.

Amidst a bloody slog, Ukraine needs this shot in the arm—a strong show of support in arms & morale, with momentum-building bipartisan backing. Among the arms should be longer range artillery (ATACMS), air support (fighter planes & drones), & more game changing weapons.

Power Five realignment turmoil highlights & heightens the urgency of protecting college athletes—as many schools seem to put profits first. Our bipartisan discussion draft focusing on health & education, not just NIL, should move forward.

We cannot compromise on our commitment to the men & women who risked everything to assist our mission in Afghanistan. We must pass the Afghan Adjustment Act ASAP to give these allies a path to permanent US status. It’s our duty. 
washingtonpost.com/opinions/…

Save a Suit is providing veterans with the professional attire they need to be hired & hold good jobs, along with employment assistance& mental health resources. Very inspiring to visit the event & watch vets trying on clothes that will help them achieve their dreams.
Happy 233rd birthday @USCG! Today we celebrate your brave service— keeping our nation safe. Semper Paratus.

Wonderful to be at KNOX’s community gardens. Eating well is key to longevity & a good quality of life. Fresh produce at CT farmers markets is available to eligible seniors through the farmers market nutrition program. We must support this effort & our local farmers.

It’s not really that difficult. Adopt the same ethics code that applies to every other federal judge. Supreme Court standards should be no lower, indeed they should be higher, as the highest court. washingtonpost.com/politics/…
I’ll continue to advocate bipartisan legislation with Sen. Grassley to allow TV coverage of appropriate trials. This one clearly needs it.

Americans deserve & need to see & hear the Trump trial—first hand, in real time—not through lawyers, media, or observers. Chief Justice Roberts should lead, if necessary through the Judicial Conference, to let sunlight into the courtroom. washingtonpost.com/opinions/…
Stamford’s Police Night Out attended by law enforcement, & community groups like the Stamford Veterans Resource Center. Police officers celebrated & thanked—& dunked.

I’ve watched the Sandor family speak truth to power about why the Seaman Xavier Sandor Support for Sailors Act is necessary to improve servicemembers’ living conditions & mental health support. I’m so proud that this lifesaving measure was included & passed in this year’s NDAA.

Despite recalls, dangerous infant loungers are still being resold online. The burden should be on the manufacturers & resellers, like Facebook Marketplace, to stop the sale of these items. The CPSC must also issue stronger rules for these products.

There is something particularly repugnant about allegations that a public official used the levers of power to overthrow an election—after he knows he’s been defeated. It strikes at the core of our democracy.

Our justice system has an obligation to pursue the facts & law wherever they lead. Former President Trump will have the same rights as any criminal defendant & the justice system will presume him innocent until proven guilty.

No person is above the law—& violations should be pursued no matter how powerful the person is. A grand jury has decided to charge former President Trump after an intensive investigation lasting many months. nytimes.com/live/2023/08/01/…

Glad to see that players will now have the final say on any agreement between the PGA & PIF. As merger plans continue to develop, I urge these top-tier golfers to closely & critically scrutinize the details of any proposed final agreement. nytimes.com/2023/08/01/sport…
I’m hoping all new regulations will be issued & made effective soon by the Biden Administration under the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act.

Stronger enforcement of new licensing & background check requirements can help stop potentially deadly sales to criminals & other dangerous buyers—including sales from online businesses, one of the fastest growing sources. 
nytimes.com/2023/08/01/us/gu…
And while he’s there, we can talk about ethical lapses & a Supreme Court code of conduct.

If Justice Alito is willing to expound to the Wall Street Journal that Congress has no authority over the Court, he should come before Congress to tell us directly why—in testimony before the Judiciary Committee.

Liza Lee Ginoni-Gambino has made the fight against drug addiction her cause as Mrs. CT American. Proud to join her as well as family & friends at a community fundraiser in Fairfield. Rooting for her in the national competition on August 25th.

Relay teams in the annual St Vincent’s Medical Center Swim Across the Sound—100’s of swimmers—braved choppy waters to raise more than $400,000 to fight cancer.
Thank you all—organizers, swimmers, & supporters!
Greater Bridgeport Pride Festival featured great music, spirit, leaders, friends & more. A beautiful sun-filled day at Wheeler Park.

No Congressional authority over the Supreme Court—is among the most audacious, absurd, & arrogant of recent Alito misstatements. His head-smacking claim is stunning in saying the Court is answerable to no one. 
thehill.com/regulation/court…

I’m especially proud of the provisions I fought for in honor of Seaman Xavier Sandor, which will provide a Basic Housing Allowance and enhanced mental health services to spare other junior Sailors from abhorrent living conditions.
Absolutely critical to our own defense is unstinting support for Ukraine’s brave fight against Russia’s barbaric criminal invasion—a cause meriting the funding here.

Readiness requires investment in advanced technologies—submarines, helicopters, & fighter jets—but also in people, including improved education, skills training, & public health resources necessary for servicemembers & workforce development.

Second, a quick update: I just got out of surgery to repair the minor fracture to my upper femur. The surgery was completely successful and the staff, docs, and everyone here at Stamford Hospital has been magnificent.

First, HUGE congratulations to the NATIONAL CHAMPION Quinnipiac Bobcats men’s hockey team. Last night’s historic overtime win was spectacular and we are all so excited and proud. Rand Pecknold and his team have built the program into a true powerhouse.
Proud to be there. GO HUSKIES.

What can I say, I love a parade! Thanks to Chris & everyone for the well wishes. I did indeed fracture my femur after a fellow parade goer tripped & fell on me during the parade today. Routine surgery tomorrow just to make sure everything heals properly. I expect a full recovery!
We are a nation of immigrants—our diversity making us the greatest nation in the world—as I saw again so inspiringly at the naturalization ceremony yesterday in Hartford.

Proud to join local leaders as Stamford designates Kramatorsk, Ukraine a sister city—impressive morale & moral support from CT’s Ukrainian-American community & Ukraine Aid International are critical to countering Russia’s brutal invasion.

Excited to join the CT delegation in introducing a resolution honoring our national champion @UConnMBB. 

Make no mistake—Storrs is the college basketball capital of the world. We’re so proud of this team and program.

Republicans like to say they believe decisions about abortion should be left up to individual states, but that’s a lie—their goal, partially realized by today’s opinion, is to force the entire country to live by their draconian restrictions on reproductive care.

This opinion would restrict the freedom of doctors & prescribers who want to provide reproductive care & every patient who seeks to receive it. Under this ruling, CT providers would no longer be able to treat CT patients according to what has been the standard of care for 20 yrs.

If allowed to go into effect, this is tantamount to a nationwide ban on the most common form of abortion care. Mifepristone has been used safely&effectively for 20 yrs w/ FDA approval for abortion care & miscarriage management—now recklessly overruled by an activist judge in TX.

First the facts—then remedies. Justice Thomas’ defiance of fundamental norms & standards can be disregarded only if Supreme Court Justices are above the law. Even without a code of ethics, an investigation is a moral & legal imperative.

The attempted explanation for the Thomas travesty would flunk a first-year law student’s ethics exam—completely not credible & infuriating. He’s adding evidence & impetus for legislation establishing an ethics code for SCOTUS & an Inspector General for the courts.

Justice Thomas' practices will be a stain on this Court & Chief Justice Roberts’ legacy if he fails to take strong, immediate action. Begin with an independent investigation of these blatant ethical violations. Next, disclose findings & conclusions.

Inducting heroes into its Hall of Fame, the CT Firefighters Association last night showcased some of the best of its great profession from around the state. We owe firefighters so much for their constant bravery, dedication, & skill, but also their families, who serve as well.

Last night’s annual Rivera Memorial Foundation dinner saluted community leaders & impressive scholarship winners carrying on the public service dedication of Firefighter Rivera. His life was cut short all too soon, but his legacy continues to inspire others.
Cleaner water & better sewage disposal are basic to health & safety in Manchester. A new $1.8 million grant will help make it possible. Delighted to join town leaders in announcing it.

Harm reduction requires price reduction—specifically making Narcan affordable. 

The FDA just ruled it can be sold over the counter without prescriptions. I’m urging the manufacturer, Emergent BioSolutions, to cut its price & for competitors to come to market.

Dredging harbor grants are vital to shoreline towns like Greenwich that depend on them for public safety, recreation, & local business. The Greenwich grant will help test sediment so removal can be done without environmental harm.
Thrilled to be @HartfordStage to announce $100,000 in federal funds for summer arts programs. This funding will inspire students to dream big & have fun.

Beer Bats are a fun way to enjoy the game—thanks to the initiative & ingenuity of Sam McGee at Green Egg Design. You’ll see them at @GoYardGoats games & Major League parks nationwide. Drink responsibly!

The GAO’s decision is deeply disappointing & infuriating. Sikorsky & its world-class workforce produce the best helicopters for our nation. I’ll continue supporting their efforts to provide our servicemembers with versatile & unmatched CT-made aircraft. 
breakingdefense.com/2023/04/…

If the Justices have real respect for the law, they’ll authorize an independent investigation—by an Inspector General-type official—after this eye-opening report. We need reforms that allow for enforcement against this contempt for the law & a new Supreme Court Code of Ethics.

Justice Thomas’ failure to disclose millions in gifts—the use of a billionaire’s private jet, luxury yacht, & exclusive resort—is brazenly unethical. 
propublica.org/article/clare…
To all celebrating, a healthy, happy, sweet Passover with family & friends.

With rates at the highest level they’ve been in decades, we are in the midst of a maternal mortality emergency—especially for Black & Brown mothers. This deadly disparity is disgraceful. I’m urging action to address this public health crisis.

Moving, joyful Ramadan celebration in Newtown’s Town Hall last weekend, with hundreds coming together for wonderful fellowship & food as well as faith. A truly diverse community gathering—different faiths & backgrounds. An American tableau.

Proud to be at the $2M grant announcement for the the New London Community Center. As this recreational area takes shape it is sure to be the beating heart of the community. Big round of applause for Mayor Passero & all the advocates who have worked to make this dream a reality.

The Chamber of Commerce of Eastern CT’s new Innovation Center will provide hope & support to budding entrepreneurs. Start-up training, technical apprenticeships, & business development are absolutely critical to bolster new businesses in our state.

Proud to celebrate the grand opening of BristolWorks! providing job training and spurring Bristol economic renaissance. BristolWorks! helps those entering the labor market or changing careers, but also assists Ukrainian refugees as they find jobs in CT.

Proud to join this weekend in a wonderful historic celebration in Greenwich—the Grand Opening & Ribbon Cutting of the Igor Tulchinsky Chabad Center For Jewish Life. A beautiful, moving ceremony with deep gratitude & Mazel Tov to Rabbi Yossi Deren & all who made it possible.

Everybody loved John—as I saw sitting near him in the state House—a farmer legislator who showed up after milking his cows, a decorated WW II vet, devoted to his family & country. A big man, with a big heart, & great humor. Nobody like him then, none again.legacy.com/us/obituaries/jou…

Larrye deBear was a gifted wordsmith, dedicated public servant, tireless reporter, & insightful advisor. He was also a mensch—with a big heart & great humor. I’m grateful to have known him. My sympathies go to his family. wtnh.com/news/politics/forme…
The best! Huskies made a dream come true. Skill, stamina, teamwork—you’re true champions. You made us proud beyond words.
.@UConn Basketball means greatness. I know they will prove it tonight. Let’s do this Huskies! #Made4March

No excuse for DOD disregarding K2 veterans’ care. They deserve vital information about exposure to toxins from DOD. I stand with the @SFF_K2, @CTVeteransLegal, & @YaleVetsClinic as they fight for necessary treatment, diagnoses, & justice.

Making our roads safer for all will save lives & prevent serious injuries. This $240,000 in federal funding for the Lower CT RiverCOG is absolutely critical to developing a comprehensive safety plan of action to reduce transportation accidents.

Rising numbers of hate crimes, white supremacist&anti-Semitic incidents are a call to action. I joined great community leaders in Bloomfield to urge more resources for DOJ’s Community Relations Service, & law enforcement. Insidious efforts to intimidate&divide us must be fought.

Habitat for Humanity does more than just put roofs over heads—it builds & bolsters real homes, families & neighborhoods. It spreads a spirit of caring & community. That spirit was compelling this weekend at the annual celebration of its staff, board, volunteers & new homeowners.
Proud to join Beth El’s wonderful congregation in celebrating the synagogue’s 180 years of wisdom, faith, community leadership & tikkun olam. Inspiring & uplifting program last night.

Kids In Crisis directly helped 4,590 children last year alone, & more than 165,000 since beginning in 1978. A deep debt of gratitude is owed to staff, volunteers, board members, & most especially, longstanding leader Shari Shapiro. No wonder last night’s gala was sold out.

With great spirit & good fellowship, New Haven’s firefighters & police squared off on the ice yesterday. The Chiefs’ Cup is always a hockey match to remember—& to thank & honor the brave men & women who face a lot more than stick & pucks to keep us safe.

As we tell our children, actions speak louder than words. The UN allowing Russia to head the Security Council is more than a symbol, it’s a moral surrender. “It’s their turn,” is no excuse. It’s their turn in criminal court.

Crimes against humanity, an arrest warrant from the ICC, brutal barbaric bombing of innocent civilians, & much more—America has ample evidence to make the case against this moral travesty. Protests should be ear splitting globally, even if our practical procedures are limited.

Corrupt moral complicity—that’s the UN’s message to the world if it allows Russia to preside over the Security Council beginning Monday. America & its allies should do everything possible to block state sponsor of terrorism Russia from leading the Council. nytimes.com/2023/04/02/world…

At First Cathedral Church, leaders showed today how we can come together to stop gun violence, particularly through community intervention. Inspired by them I’ll continue this fight for a ban on assault weapons, Ethan’s Law for safe storage, better background checks, & more.

This significant step puts us on the right side of history. Crimes against humanity of such heinous scope & scale cry out for justice. There’s no way to bring back Putin’s innocent victims or undo his damage, but a special tribunal (like Nuremberg) can provide some closure.

Our justice system has an obligation to pursue the facts & law wherever they lead. Former President Trump will have the same rights as any criminal defendant & the justice system will presume him innocent until proven guilty.

No person is above the law—& violations should be pursued no matter how powerful the person is. A grand jury has reportedly decided to charge former President Trump after an intensive investigation lasting many months.
Americans should be infuriated that right wing extremism has so incredibly infected the federal judiciary. Historic harm not only to women’s health care but the credibility of our courts.

The right wing’s mission to dismantle the ACA is an all-out attack on the public’s wellbeing. 

Revoking mandatory cost-free preventive treatments, like cancer screenings, PrEP, pregnancy care, & mental health checks radically jeopardizes the health of millions of Americans.
Widely available access to over-the-counter Narcan will save lives. This important, welcome step by the FDA is absolutely critical to reducing the overdose epidemic. cnn.com/2023/03/29/health/fd…

It’s deeply unfair that college athletes like UConn’s Adama Sanogo & Aaliyah Edwards are barred from NIL opportunities because of international student visa restrictions. Exciting to hear Sec. Mayorkas commit to moving as quickly as possible to give these students a fair shot.

Children escaped the Sandy Hook shooter when he changed magazines. The same happens in other attacks with assault weapons. Limits on magazine capacity would help save lives. If we can’t ban assault weapons, let’s at least restrict high capacity magazines. washingtonpost.com/nation/in…

I look forward to learning more from the schools themselves about what outreach they’ve received from sports betting companies, particularly in light of AGA’s new industry standards that make clear that any sports betting partnerships with schools is unacceptable. 4
Caesars’ irresponsible—& on occasion, potentially illegal—marketing to college students through their schools remains entirely unacceptable. 3/
Unfortunately, the benefits of this new code are limited given that not all sports betting companies–in fact, many of the largest ones–aren’t members of the AGA & don’t abide by their standards. 2/

The AGA's new sports betting code of conduct is a serious effort to protect young people from gambling addiction. I applaud AGA for seeking to set meaningful standards that prohibit college partnerships that promote, market, or advertise sports betting. 1/ apnews.com/article/sports-be…

I’m demanding to know how some schools are marketing sports betting, with big money contracts from casino sportbook enterprises—possibly using student information to pitch gambling apps, with addictive & destructive potential consequences. 4

We can do this—stop assault weapon carnage. I’ll keep working for commonsense measures like red flag laws, safe storage, better background checks, & more. An assault weapons ban must be a priority among them.

Again & again, it’s the assault weapons enabling mass murder. Our legislative ban would save lives. Even as we grieve, let’s honor with action. Take steps toward a clear lawful remedy. Congress is complicit if again it looks away. Inaction is inexcusable.

Americans deserve a fight in Congress to ban these military style assault weapons—causing unspeakable tragedy & trauma. These laws work, as we know in CT. Failure to act won’t work anymore for America. nytimes.com/2023/03/27/us/na…

In CT we are lucky to have organizations like the Council on Problem Gambling to help raise awareness & provide recovery support. With the explosion in online gambling these resources are all the more vital. 3

Today, I am sending a letter to the top revenue generating basketball & football colleges demanding more information about these partnerships. Schools have an obligation to care for students not put them in danger of developing a gambling addiction. 2/

We are approaching the height of March Madness & also the height of online gambling. To max out on the money, schools are sidelining the health & well-being of students in favor of lucrative on-campus gambling contracts. 1/

Children dead & gravely injured. Casualties of gunfire. My heart is with the Covenant School community. 

Congress can help stop this senseless violence—now. Our thoughts & prayers are not enough. abcnews.go.com/US/multiple-p…

After losing its FAA nominee, I hope the Administration will land one without another lengthy holding pattern. A year’s vacancy at the FAA’s top is already regrettable—& urgent challenges facing airlines demand solutions. Meantime, let’s pass my Airline Passengers Bill of Rights.

Sal DePiano was many things to many people over many years—community leader, state senator, musician, veteran, lawyer, & much more. Most important—a caring & dedicated public servant, generous friend, a real gentleman. My heart is with his family. onlyinbridgeport.com/wordpre…

CT House of Heroes annual “fun raiser” was sold out, a record crowd celebrating their unbelievable work for our veterans. They rebuild homes, transform lives, honor true heroes. Nearly 200 homes! Thank you!

As Trump threatens a prosecutor, incites violence&endangers democracy, Republicans must finally stand up&speak out to condemn Trump’s replay of riling up extremists to physical obstruction. Silence is complicity.

Over the years, I’ve watched Republican colleagues again&again duck, bob&weave when they admit standing up to Trump was the right thing to do—for the country, their conscience&even their party. Mueller’s findings, impeachment’s votes, Jan 6th—&more. Now they face a perilous test.

Hundreds of dedicated environmental activists & advocates gathered at Wesleyan yesterday for the CT Land Conservation Council annual conference. Very inspiring to be among these steadfast, unstinting leaders.

The FCC should protect domestic violence survivors by guaranteeing the privacy of their cellphone calls for help, & access to free cell service. Joining with @TheCenter_CT to help stop abusers from tracking & threatening.

Packed house at the VA in West Haven this morning with veterans taking advantage of new PACT Act opportunities & benefits for their exposure to burn pits & other toxic chemicals. Glad they’re getting what they deserve. More should be done. We’re raising awareness.

Nothing comic about junk fees— concealed charges that are nickel-&-diming Americans. My Junk Fee Prevention Act would force disclosure & restrict them. Airlines, hotels, concerts—the list is endless—should be held accountable. washingtonpost.com/business/…

Pres. Biden has decisively denounced Putin for “crimes against humanity” but action speaks louder than words. He must now order the Pentagon to provide documents, photos&other evidence supporting the ICC’s quest for justice. Noncooperation isn’t acceptable.reuters.com/world/us/us-sena…

Spring time is tick time, beginning right now. A warm winter means more of them, some like the Asian longhorned ticks, are new to this region. Safeguard yourself with the right clothes, insect repellent, & more. Diseases like Lyme & Babesiosis can be debilitating, even lethal.

Tick-borne diseases, like ticks, are exploding in number. Babesiosis cases rose 338%, Lyme doubled in recent years. I helped get $200,000 to CT’s Agricultural Station, $26 million to CDC, $7 million to DOD, all for vital research, diagnosis, & treatment.

Tremendously honored to be awarded the 2022 Humane Legislator of the Year Award for my work on the Big Cat Public Safety Act. As a two time recipient of this recognition, I remain deeply committed to championing legislation that will improve the treatment of animals.

I’ve been sounding an alarm for months about shortcomings&shrinkages in our defense production capacity. Mergers&supply chain issues are only part of the problem. America is neglecting our biggest resource—people. And our key challenge—workforce training. nytimes.com/2023/03/24/us/po…

No one better exemplifies public service than Mayor O’Leary. From his career as police chief to his distinguished tenure as mayor, Mayor O’Leary has worked tirelessly to make his city a better place for all. I congratulate him & wish him all the best in this next chapter.

Even a U.S.-operated TikTok would still pose the danger of driving destructive, toxic content to young people, exacerbating a serious youth mental health crisis. We need to pass the Kids Online Safety Act to give kids & parents real tools & safeguards across all platforms.

If any proof were needed, today’s hearing shows TikTok must be divested & radically reformed to stop a clear & present danger to both national security & children’s safety. washingtonpost.com/technolog…

From flight tickets to concerts & gym memberships, hidden fees are everywhere. My Junk Fee Prevention Act with @SenWhitehouse will provide greater transparency—building upon the Biden Admin’s work to make sure Americans aren’t nickel-and-dimed.

Making it as easy to unsubscribe as it is to subscribe is a no brainer. Glad the FTC is moving forward with proposals to ensure consumers aren’t being charged junk fees for services they no longer want or need. vox.com/technology/2023/3/23…
This new rule will continue to correct these historic wrongs & do right by survivors’ families so that no one has to fight for benefits they rightly deserve. It’s a matter of simple justice.

Sadly, in passing the PACT Act last year, we were too late for thousands of veterans who suffered years of pain & sickness following their service—including CT resident Peter Antioho who died in 2019 of terminal brain cancer.

I’m proud beyond words that relief will be available for surviving family members of veterans who died from the horrific diseases caused by exposure to burn pits & toxic chemicals. military.com/daily-news/2023…
The status quo is fundamentally unfair. International students should be given the opportunity to take advantage of their name, image, & likeness just like their teammates.
Ramadan Mubarak! Wishing Muslims in CT & across the nation a special time for reflection, prayer, & gathering with loved ones.
Suppose Putin wins in Ukraine. If he’s not stopped there, he & China’s Xi will be on the march—emboldened & enabled. Delay in arming Ukrainian fighters endangers America.

Suppose Ukrainian troops were fighting for our freedom & independence—not just theirs. Would we take this long to provide them what they need to win? But—that’s the point—they are fighting for our national security.

Suppose it were our American troops fighting Russia’s murderous assault. Would it take this long to provide artillery, ammunition, tanks, aircraft, & other weapons needed to win? Ukrainians don’t want our troops. They desperately need our arms—now. washingtonpost.com/world/202…

This new office would mobilize professionals across federal agencies, enable outreach to state & local leaders, collect & report more data, & innovate with other expanded action. The Office of Gun Violence Prevention Act should be noncontroversial & bipartisan.
It can bring together survivors, students, veterans, families, & others tragically impacted with policymakers & law enforcement officials in hands-on programs to stop this scourge.

A central point of leadership is vital to federal efforts against the epidemic of gun violence. The Office of Gun Violence Prevention would be more than just a symbol; it can help marshal & focus the diverse resources & partners necessary to make progress.

.@SenWhitehouse & my Junk Fee Prevention Act will help end this price gouging—forcing full disclosure upfront & restricting abusive fees. It will mandate basic commonsense fairness & transparency, which consumers rightly demand & deserve.

Concealed surprise fees—nickel & diming Americans to distraction—must be stopped. Airline travel, concert going, common purchases—seemingly almost everywhere—consumers are compelled to pay hidden excessive charges.
Fixing this discriminatory practice is long overdue. It’s time to ensure our nation’s nutrition aid is available to all who need it.

The people of Puerto Rico deserve access to full SNAP benefits—just like the rest of their fellow Americans. Our legislation addresses the historic inequities that prevent those on the island from putting food on the table & feeding their families.

Wonderful to be at @UNewHaven to announce a $1M grant for the Henry Lee College of Criminal Justice & Forensic Sciences. Breaking down barriers between the community & local police is critical for reducing gun violence.

As sports betting peaks, March Madness is a good time for colleges to act against rampant gambling on campuses. Right now many are exacerbating & even profiting from it through deals with casinos. Schools should take Problem Gambling Awareness Month as a teaching moment.

Exciting visit to RDSI to learn about cutting edge technology protecting our Navy from threats undersea & surface, & enabling faster, stronger communication. They’re also devising & disseminating tools to counter cyber attacks to local government & others. Very impressive.
Wagner Group is a murderous terrorist organization committing crimes against humanity. You’d think social media would avoid becoming a tool in its hideous handiwork. wsj.com/video/series/in-dept…

A $2M grant to Habitat for Humanity will enable 10 families to have homes in Bridgeport—a proud day, & prouder still when we cut the ribbons. Sweat equity from future homeowners, skills & resources from Habitat, support from the community—helping to solve the housing crisis.
Pleased to join SEIU 1199 in urging HHS Dept authorities (CMS) to issue long promised staffing standards for nursing homes, & resources necessary to meet them. Residents & caregivers deserve them.

Educators&parents recognize that Big Tech’s ongoing harm needs to be halted. They’re desperate to stop social media from exacerbating a frightening youth mental health crisis—same goal as my Kids Online Safety Act. Congress should help them: pass it now.washingtonpost.com/education…

The former president is fanning the flames of outrage&inciting his base. As we head into next week, let’s be guided by facts not provocative “leaks” meant only to incite controversy. I call on my Republican colleagues to condemn any possible violence, not condone&encourage it.
Honoring veterans of WW II, Korea, & Vietnam in Trumbull. They & their families deserve our unconditional gratitude.
A beautiful day for Meriden’s St. Patrick’s Day Parade, with warm, welcoming crowds & enthusiastic marchers. Proud to be with you.

Inspiring, exciting student projects at the Science & Engineering Fair today, with $500,000 in scholarships awarded. Thanks to students, teachers, parent, organizers, sponsors, & others who made it a truly special day. A very hopeful sign for our great nation’s future.
Knights of St. Patrick gathered last night—a resounding success—thanks to hard work & impressive skill of leaders who carry on this wonderful tradition. Gratitude to all.
Congratulations to the Royal Tabaq Restaurant & Banquet Hall as we cut the ribbon opening this exciting new business in Meriden. Renovated, renamed, rejuvenated—promising magnificent food & ambiance.

US citizens in Israel are encountering inexplicable difficulties obtaining passports. These seemingly unnecessary obstacles are deeply frustrating before the Passover holiday. I am demanding that the State Department end these delays.
Bridgeport’s parade is back—louder & prouder than ever, as the St. Patrick’s Day festivities brighten the beautiful Black Rock community. Lot of eyes smiling, all of us Irish today.

Who was in charge of the orphanages or other places were kidnapped & stolen children were illicitly taken in Russia? NATO & American intelligence should share facts about Russians who aided & abetted crimes against humanity.

A moral & legal hit to Putin—this ICC action is all the more reason to designate Russia a state sponsor of terrorism. The Administration should act on our Senate Resolution, unanimously passed last year.

Putin’s barbaric, genocidal undertakings should be punished. Glad to see the ICC taking steps to make sure strong accountability is handed out for his heinous, inhuman actions. apnews.com/article/icc-putin…
Announcing the bipartisan GUARD Act to protect veterans against unaccredited predatory representatives who exploit their claims for disability benefits.

The American public should not be left holding the bag. The DEPOSIT Act would claws back bank execs self-serving payouts & stock transactions—returning the money to taxpayers & protecting depositors. This is the first step in even broader, necessary banking reform.

We must meet the sheer greed of Silicon Valley Bank’s top executives with accountability. It is deeply unacceptable that as their business was collapsing & depositors’ money disappearing, these so called “leaders” were lining their pockets.

President Biden is right to call on Congress to give regulators authorities to claw back compensation from self-dealing execs. In the wake of Silicon Valley Bank’s collapse, the Senate must take action & swiftly take up my DEPOSIT Act for a vote. subscriber.politicopro.com/a…
Irish flag raising on #StPatricksDay—song & spirit shared by all! A special occasion in Bridgeport to celebrate a special heritage & community.

China’s complicity will have consequences if President Xi stokes Russia’s murderous war machine with arms. There must be accountability for any aiding & abetting of Putin’s crimes against humanity. nytimes.com/live/2023/03/17/…

Poland is leading again—showing how to face Russia’s monstrous threat head on. Knowing how crucial planes are to Ukraine, Poland also knows Putin likely will be coming for them next if he wins in Ukraine.

I applaud Poland’s decision to once again lead in the fight to bring advanced weaponry to Ukraine. The US & the rest of NATO must soon follow—showing stalwart support for Ukraine's herculean efforts to repel Russia’s invasion. washingtonpost.com/world/202…

Gun violence prevention measures could be made vastly more difficult by SCOTUS’ Bruen decision. I spoke with Professor Ruben about what the implications might be for lifesaving safe storage legislation like Ethan’s Law.
By repealing Section 6(b), our measure would free the CPSC to swiftly warn the public about hazardous products & require companies to put people ahead of profits.

The Sunshine in Product Safety Act removes the regulatory straightjacket that deprives consumers of vital product safety information. Current regulatory requirements give companies the right to veto vital CPSC warnings & deny the truth to consumers.
Strong support this morning for Ukraine at the Yale SOM Corporate Summit—briefed by Sen. Graham & me, with wonderful Ambassador Oksana Makarova attending.

We won’t leave the American public holding the bag for another failed bank whose top executives lined their pockets on the way out. This commonsense step should be accompanied by other even broader systemic reforms.
The legislation claws back self-dealing payouts & stock transaction benefits to top bank leaders, returning the money to taxpayers & protecting depositors.

This measure answers the common call for accountability to meet sheer corporate greed—Silicon Valley Bank top executives pocketing huge bonuses even as their business was collapsing & depositors’ money was disappearing into thin air.

I’ve introduced the DEPOSIT Act that will claw back any stock or bonus benefits that top execs at Silicon Valley Bank or elsewhere received before their institutions collapsed. I hope for bipartisan support & an early vote to impose accountability.

More than just a rhetorical exercise, today’s FAA Safety Call To Action must in fact produce action to reform our underfunded & overwhelmed aviation system. Safety leadership has been lacking in airlines, the FAA &, yes, Congress. washingtonpost.com/opinions/…
Equal pay for equal work—it’s that simple. We must pass the #PaycheckFairness Act to close the worsening wage gap & help end pay discrimination. #EqualPayDay

Sam Cingari was one of the kindest, warmest human beings I’ve known. Community minded to the core, he was endlessly generous&open-hearted to good causes. A true leader for the city, state&nation he loved. Cynthia&I send sympathies to his beautiful family.stamfordadvocate.com/news/ar…

Ann Uccello was a CT trailblazer whose impressive determination & enthusiasm made her a champion for our capital city. Her life of service deeply impacted our state & nation. My thoughts are with her loved ones. wtnh.com/news/connecticut/ha…

Increasing the number of gun sales subject to background checks, encouraging the use of red flag laws, & promoting safe storage—President Biden’s executive action will save lives. Glad the President is doubling down on the progress made by the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act.

I'll be introducing legislation with @RepAdamSchiff  to hold bank executives accountable—especially for the kinds of bonuses taken by leaders at Silicon Valley Bank hours before its collapse. We need to claw back these self-serving payouts & return these funds to taxpayers.
Last year CT roads were deadlier than ever. With this $200,000 grant Torrington will be able to fight back against these fatalities & improve street safety. A model & leader in safety.

Intercommunity is a place of real care—a beacon of hope. The $1.8 million in federal funding @ChrisMurphyCT & I announced today will enable major expansion & enhancement at their North End facility. Thousands more people will have the benefits of this world class health care.

A rousing, resounding St. Patrick’s Day Parade in New Haven on an exquisitely beautiful afternoon—all of us proudly Irish for this spirited march. The town boasting green, end to end. Thanks to the Associated Irish Societies for all your hard work!

Bank CEO’s shouldn’t walk away with millions while others pay the price. Right away, we must tighten laws to protect our banking system from excessive risk & mismanagement. I voted against weakening the laws in 2018.

Bank executives responsible for this mess should be held accountable. First priority—assure stability of banking system & depositor money without taxpayer dollars. But second, right away, make sure mismanagement is investigated & pursued. nytimes.com/2023/03/13/opini…

A moving, inspiring concert to benefit Ukrainian soldier amputees—brave freedom fighters who’ve suffered brutal wounds in their battle against Russian criminal aggression & atrocities, & need prosthetics. Thanks to Operation Renew Prosthetics for advancing this critical cause.
I’ve heard from diverse interests around CT & elsewhere about the ramifications of closing SVB & Signature Bank. I hope this action provides some real time reassurance.

There should be significant comfort in this robust program: backups & safeguards, above the $250,000 FDIC insurance, & a major facility supporting banks—at no (zero) cost to taxpayers & with no protections for shareholders.

After just finishing a briefing with the Fed, FDIC, Treasury & White House, I’m reassured their strong, prompt action will help avert further instability. The goal is to make depositors, banks, & others aware that fear driven withdrawals are unnecessary & unhelpful.

This recall is deadly serious—eye drops causing infections, blindness, & even death. After cases in CT & nationwide—Artificial Tears & other Ezricare products have been recalled because of bacteria contamination. Check medicine cabinets, & discard.apnews.com/article/eyedrops-…

Nobody makes submarines like EB’s world class workforce. No Navy has skills on Virginia Attack Class submarines like our sailors. The Aussies & Brits can learn from them, & we’ll learn from our great sea power allies. Strength in unity.

American shipbuilders & sailors will be critical to making this new undersea warfare alliance work—to construct & run the Virginia Class subs initially while providing skills & training to our indispensable allies. nytimes.com/2023/03/09/us/po…

Moving is a hassle but can be made a nightmare when moving companies hold hostage people’s possessions until they pay additional fees. The number of these scams is skyrocketing&enforcement hasn’t kept pace. I’m asking DOT to take strong action to penalize this fraudulent conduct.

Wonderful to be in Guilford today to announce this important $500,000 in funding for the Guilford Harbor project. Dredging of the area is absolutely necessary to maintain usability of Guilford’s waterways—increasing its recreational potential & spurring economic growth.

One wrong move is all it takes to cause serious, sometimes fatal, injury on the roads. Glad $500,000 in federal funding is going to help reverse the tragic trend of wrong-way crashes—making our roads safer for all drivers.

Section 230 was designed to promote a safer internet, but right now it’s doing the opposite. My Subcommittee’s hearing this week made clear there is an emerging, bipartisan consensus to reform this long outdated shield.

Twitter has allegedly misused sensitive private data for advertising—recklessly leaving it open to foreign espionage & violating its consent decree. No matter who owns Twitter, the @FTC has an obligation to investigate breaches & vigorously enforce the law.nytimes.com/2023/03/07/techn…

Dedicated to opening the courthouse doors to underserved communities, she also has qualities of compassion & empathy which so deeply impressed me & my Senate colleagues. She’s an exceptional jurist & human being.
Maria Kahn epitomizes public service. She’s the real deal—with unexcelled breadth of experience—& will bring to the federal bench truly extraordinary expertise & intellect.

Skill training is a matter of national security. It’s essential to our national economic & societal health—but, even more, our national defense. That’s why I successfully urged funding in our NDAA for apprenticeship programs at EB in Groton. Only a start toward what’s needed.

To put American defense manufacturing on proper pace, the key is training skilled workers. Talk to any defense contractor or supplier—those who make artillery, ammunition, air defense systems, stingers, javelins, & all the other vital arms. They’re desperate for skilled workers.

America’s defense manufacturing capacity needs to be expanded—on a wartime footing—to ensure America's security requirements that include assistance to Ukraine & other allies, not peacetime pace. It’s called investment. washingtonpost.com/national-…

The talents of our Groton workforce are truly world-class. Australia is smart to purchase US submarines & the Navy must continue to support this industrial base as it builds two VA-class boats a year. reuters.com/business/aerospa…

It will reverse the draconian & devastating bans & restrictions that fall on all women, & disproportionately on Black & Latina people, individuals with lower incomes, the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities, & so many others who face barriers to care.
The heart of the Women’s Health Protection Act is reproductive justice—the fundamental right to safely choose if or when to have children, & the freedom to make that choice no matter your zip code.

The #WomensHealthProtectionAct would reverse the death sentence handed down to American women when SCOTUS overturned 50 years of precedent in Roe. This issue is about more than health care; it is about women’s rights, individual rights, & human rights.

On #InternationalWomensDay we celebrate the countless contributions & unwavering courage of women around the world fighting for equality & personal freedoms. Thank you for helping make the world a more just & equal place.
