After three airlines heeded public pressure & removed family seating fees, @USDOT’s new dashboard will allow consumers to make smarter, more informed purchasing choices. I’ll continue to push for legislation to stop these hidden junk fees.

PFAS is an environmental curse—all too common, often contaminating drinking water—that nearly $19 million in federal funding now will help remedy in CT. Proud to announce it last week, bettering health & safety.

Training of pilots, providing the F-16s—more than just a couple—is absolutely urgent, right now. The fight hangs in the balance, for us as well as Ukraine. I’ve seen Ukrainian soldiers’ can do spirit. No question: They can do it, if they have the arms. nbcnews.com/investigations/t…

Caving to these right wing AGs’ threats is a deeply damaging, destructive precedent. During this moment of crisis for reproductive health care, providers have a moral imperative to ensure those who need access to care continue to receive it.

When bullied by Republican state AGs, Walgreens is willing to sacrifice women’s access to care. Patients nationwide have a right to the medication they need. I am writing to Walgreens demanding they reverse this craven, cowardly surrender.

A lasting legacy left by Elan Ganeles—we can love even when we disagree—whose life was senselessly cut short by hate & violence. Hearing about this amazing young man from grieving family & friends at Shiva, I’m heartbroken for them & the whole world. May his memory be a blessing.

Celebrating Centenarian birthdays—14, incredibly—at the annual Jewish Senior Services Brunch. At 100 years old, their vitality & positivity is a tribute to their loving families & superb health care. Very uplifting!
Norwich paints the town green—at least in spirit—with a rousing St. Patrick’s Day Parade. Perfect weather, big crowds, great joy.

Strong support for cancer research is one of Melissa Marottoli Hogan’s lasting legacies—10 years after her tragic passing—due to the courage, generosity & grace of her family & friends. Sold out, Gala For A Cure, in Branford last night drew hundreds to fight this disease.
Hugely successful Associated Irish Societies Ball supporting the New Haven St. Patrick’s Day Parade—6th oldest in the nation, & one of the biggest. Proud to march every year.

The Bushnell is back, big time, as shown by its Ovations Gala&steadily growing audiences. Grit, guts&hard work from staff, board, donors, artists&employees enabled it to weather the pandemic storm. Proud to help lead the Shuttered Venue Operators Grant program, which helped too.

Amazing celebration of Black History & Heritage at Mount Zion Church in Hamden last night. Awesome music, poetry, essays, & much more—a lot presented by incredible young people. Thank you for sharing!
Wonderful Waterbury St. Patrick’s Day Ceremony & Parade—cool & windy but warm-hearted. Grateful to a great Irish American community!
Walgreens deserves a firestorm of outrage—the proper prescription for its malady of spine & guts. Or maybe moral blindness. It’s putting profits over people.

Consumers can tell Walgreens what they think of its consummate craven caving to hard right legal puppets. They should vote with their feet, & pocketbooks. My own business is going to competitors committed to women’s health.

Walgreens’ corporate cowardice is unconscionable—a dangerous disservice to women’s health care. It’s likely to be a net money loser in the long run & cost steeply in credibility & brand value. It’s putting profits over people. Like many others, I’ll shop elsewhere.
Wonderful to be with long-standing friends like Tim Curtin at the St. Patrick’s Day Grand Marshal Dinner in Stamford. Sold out & high spirited—proud to be there.

Companies should be clamoring to withdraw from Russia—stopping their support of a state terrorism apparatus. More CEOs must see the patriotic & moral duty, as well as self-interest, in revoking their Russian business. I'll continue to pursue measures to incentivize this exodus.

No business as usual. Companies continuing to trade with Russia & bolster its economy is utterly unacceptable. Company leadership must take a tough stand against Putin’s criminal, genocidal invasion of Ukraine. 
nytimes.com/2023/03/02/busin…

I am proud to have helped secure the $250,000 in federal funding to provide 12,000 students with new books & will keep fighting to deliver more resources so that communities across CT can promote literacy & reading to all students.

A love of reading will last a lifetime, which is why I’m proud to celebrate Books Across Stamford today. Reading is not only an academic skill—it helps children develop empathy, build strong relationships, & expand their imaginations to become creative problem solvers.
Meta’s pulling kids into risky virtual realms is unacceptable. Driven purely by profit, this platform creates dangers to children’s physical & mental health.

Passengers & crew deserve to know the air they’re breathing is safe & toxin-free. My legislation, the Cabin Air Safety Act, takes action where the FAA & airline industry haven’t—requiring air detector & monitoring equipment, incident reporting, & investigations.

#WomensHistoryMonth is a celebration of trailblazers past & present who inspire us to break down barriers & shatter glass ceilings. We must continue to advance women’s equality by fighting for reproductive freedom, paycheck fairness, paid leave, & more.

I’ve seen the carnage caused when guns are unsecured & unsafely stored—suicides, accidental deaths, school shootings.

These deaths & injuries—particularly of children—can be prevented by passing Ethan's Law & requiring responsible, safe firearm storage.nationaljournal.com/s/720607…
Tech giants have long turned a blind eye to horrific harms & dangers on their platforms. Sec. 230 gives them broad legal immunity to continue doing so—demanding serious Congressional action.

This hearing will examine Big Tech’s expansive Sec. 230 legal immunities & opportunities for reform. I look forward to chairing my Subcommittee’s first hearing to carefully consider tech’s liability shield.

We cannot wait any longer to pass the ERA joint resolution. Generations have fought for this Amendment—& I’ve been a long, proud supporter. 

I asked Trinity College student Thursday Williams about what she would tell others in her generation about the importance of the ERA.

Thanks to the Conard High School students & staff who joined yesterday’s discussion on teen dating violence. It’s so important we have candid, honest conversations about what it means to be in a healthy relationship & the lasting harms of domestic violence. #TDVAM

I am deeply saddened to learn that one of CT’s own, Elan Ganeles, was killed in Israel last night. I strongly condemn this violence & hate—which only sows tragedy & grief. May Elan’s memory be a blessing & a reminder that we must all work towards peace. cnn.com/2023/02/28/middleeas…

Electric Boat’s briefing yesterday showed their professional prowess & dedication—& the need for more skilled workers. Our entire defense industrial base is at risk without increased investment in training.

This legal stretch also looms in the shadow of SCOTUS being ready to revoke relief from tens of millions of hardworking Americans. Education in this country shouldn’t come with the crush of an ever-growing mountain of student loan debt.

State AGs are seeking a special status on standing well beyond the most elastic solicitude for states' rights conceivable to the founders or common sense.  As much as I love AGs going to court, they get no free pass on standing.

No state AG has sued the federal government more often than I did during my 20 years in the CT job, but I’m alarmed & appalled by the stretch in standing sought in the student debt challenge. cnn.com/2023/01/31/politics/…

Gory proof that Instagram can’t be trusted. Measures like my bipartisan Kids Online Safety Act will help provide enforceable guardrails & ground rules to protect the public. Social media’s sickening failures are a call to action. washingtonpost.com/technolog…
But make sure this new assistance—drones, ammunition, & more—come from existing stockpiles, not dependent on new manufacturing, requiring months of delay.
Thanks to Pres. Biden for marking the anniversary of Russia’s brutal, genocidal invasion with soaring rhetoric & real action—stronger sanctions & $2 billion in military aid.

Thank you to Anna Kobylarz & the City of Goodness for providing shelter to orphans, women with children, & seniors in Ukraine. Very impressive fundraiser at New Britain’s Belvedere Restaurant tonight. You are saving lives.

Stirring vigils at Yale in New Haven & Ukrainian National Home in Hartford with young people leading prayers, songs, & speeches commemorating this first anniversary of Russia’s savage, genocidal invasion & Ukraine’s fierce, brave resistance. Proud, powerful voices.

Exciting meeting with entrepreneurs during Black Futures Week, part of Hartford’s Black History Month. They’re helping to create promising economic & job opportunities. Thanks to the SBA for bringing us together & encouraging these impressive young  businesses.

I’m demanding Fisher-Price get its deadly Rock’n Play Sleeper off the market&out of homes. Appallingly, it has caused at least 8 infant deaths since the 2019 recall&no accounting for 90% of the 4.8M still in use. One immediate step: Offer full refunds, not limited value vouchers.

FuelCell Energy in Torrington will be providing key aid to Ukraine—helping rebuild its power system. As part of a U.S. State Dept. program, this company’s cutting edge technology—solid oxide electrolysis—will enable environmentally sustainable electricity. Very exciting visit.

Two impactful nonprofits honored today—the Housing Collective, & Havenly—w/Neighborhood Builder grants from Bank of America.  I was proud to join in celebrating their work—one in enabling homes, the other in providing skills  & education to women refugees. Energizing leadership!

Cutting the ribbon for Norwalk Hospital’s expanded outpatient mental health care facility—welcoming & warm—was truly inspiring. A $2.1 million federal grant helped make it possible, but the real heroes are health care professionals, staff, board, volunteers—& patients.

Proud to stand with Gov. Lamont, Mayor Carbone & community leaders to announce SBA designating Torrington a business HUB. Increased access to federal contracts for local businesses will mean more jobs & economic opportunities. Torrington well deserves it.

Our town hall last night showed why CT’s support for Ukraine has been strong & unshakable. Diverse leaders, students, & activists said America must provide the military & humanitarian aid Ukrainians need to win. Their fierce, brave fight for freedom & democracy is ours too.

Grateful to join Commr. Saadi & CT Dept. Of Veteran Affairs in honoring brave, dedicated African American Vets as part of Black History Month. We should salute them & all vets in action, not just words, with health care, education, skill training, jobs, & more. We owe them.

On the eve of the 1 yr anniversary of the war in Ukraine, I stood w/Ukrainian Americans & @GovNedLamont to show our strong, steadfast support. This country is defending its homeland w/courage, resilience, & resolve—showing what it truly means to fight for freedom & independence.

With the proper investments we can—& will—make our streets safer for pedestrians, cyclists, & motorists. Excited to announce $400,000 in federal funding to help New Haven implement their ‘Safe Routes for All’ plan—road improvements that will save lives.

Exorbitant junk fees are rightly making customers mad. No hidden surprises. We need to put a stop to this modern day scourge through my Junk Fee Prevention Act—requiring full price disclosure upfront & setting rules against excessive fees.

President Biden is airtight right—Russia has committed crimes against humanity. Now, I hope he’ll designate Russia a state sponsor of terrorism, as our legislation mandates. It would put muscle & teeth in his eloquent condemnation. washingtonpost.com/world/202…

Putin’s suspending Russia’s role in START is truly reprehensible—but no reason to reduce, in fact every cause to increase, our commitment to Ukraine. He was already disregarding START. His speech was bunk & bluster to bolster domestic support. washingtonpost.com/world/202…

The inspiring, uplifting images of President Biden’s Kyiv visit continue to reverberate around the world. I know how difficult the security & logistics must have been for this visit—making the trip even more impactful to the Ukrainian people.

A brave, bold, & powerful move by President Biden—showing the strength of American support. Having visited Kyiv & President Zelenskyy 3 times over roughly the past year, I know how meaningful it is to Zelenskyy & the Ukrainian people. washingtonpost.com/world/202…

Spectacularly impressive CT soldiers serving & sacrificing here at Grafenwohr to train Ukrainians who are defending against Putin’s bloody genocidal attack. They tell me they’re learning a lot from the Ukrainians too.

Here at Grafenwohr Ukrainians are training on these Bradley’s to repel Russia’s imminent offensive & start their counterattack but they need tanks ASAP. One lesson: They’re driven, quick learners moving much more rapidly than our soldiers expected.

Seeing Ukrainian fighters trained more quickly & effectively on armored vehicles & other weapons should help persuade the Administration to start training on fighter jets—right away—& provide F-16’s ASAP. Claims about difficulties in training are exaggerated obstacles.

Ukrainians are defying predictions about time, cost, & difficulty of training—not surprising considering how resilient & courageous they’ve been in combat. Americans should be proud of our Army for its amazing support.

American military leaders at Grafenwohr are awed by how rapidly Ukrainians are learning how to use Bradley armored vehicles. They‘re so adept & focused that the U.S. Army has accelerated the customary training time.

Inspired & proud to visit U.S. Army Garrison Bavaria at Grafenwohr in Germany where our skilled dedicated soldiers are training Ukrainians in effective use of American weapons. “They’re quick learners—motivated beyond belief,” one told me.

If Vice President Harris is right that Russia has committed crimes against humanity—I strongly agree—the Administration should declare Russia a state sponsor of terrorism. She condemned Russia clearly & powerfully today at the Munich Security Conference—to strong applause.

Again & again, European allies telling us that training Ukrainian pilots must start now—even if the Administration delays delivery of jets—because of the lead time necessary. Russian forces outnumber Ukraine. We must assure Ukraine won’t be outgunned.

One clear takeaway from the @MunSecConf: America must provide jet fighters to Ukraine—at the very least, begin training Ukrainian pilots, as the Brits are doing now. The F-16’s are absolutely vital to stopping Russian missiles & winning the war.

Fantastic news! The Air Force is smart to give this $135M contract to Collins to manufacture propellers for the C-130 aircraft. CT’s defense production workers are world class & will get the job done.

I’m eager to discuss the extreme urgency of providing Ukraine with tanks, fighter jets, & other lethal arms necessary to win this war. The global community of democracies stands united in support of Ukraine—but we can and must hasten the speed & resources in showing that support.

Our bipartisan Congressional delegation attending the @MunSecConf will join a coalition of global leaders & experts dedicated to preserving stability & security. This gathering comes at a pivotal moment as our Ukrainian allies prepare to resist a massive Russian offensive.
Officially designating the Wager Group as a foreign terrorist organization will ramp up sanctions against its members & increase the tools available to hold them accountable.
A mercenary murderous squad with 9 years of Ukrainian blood on its hands, the Wagner Group should be called what it is: a foreign terrorist organization.

Fantastic! We need leaders like you, @EmmaLembke—sharing your story & making sure young people’s voices are heard. Can’t wait to have you back on the Hill to hit the ground running on passing online safety reforms like #KOSA.

I appreciate @POTUS telling the American people what we've been hearing behind closed doors. Greater transparency establishes greater trust in government & provides the American people with the information they deserve.

As tech giants continue to egregiously exploit personal data&put profits over safety, consumers need oversight&accountability. 

Real reforms of Big Tech’s vast power, privileges&necessary legal obligations demand serious consideration&focused action, such as Sec. 230 reform.

I’m honored to begin spearheading the Subcommittee on Privacy, Technology, & the Law with a robust agenda to serve the American people. 

Big Tech has well earned strong scrutiny & safeguards to ensure privacy, innovation, & national security.
Keeping our roadways safe for travel & transport is absolutely crucial. I am thrilled that @CTDOTOfficial is receiving $158M+ for the Gold Star Memorial Bridge project.

The attacks against @gigibsohn are nothing more than a baseless&coordinated smear campaign fueled&funded by corporate special interests. By holding the FCC hostage, they can stop the Commission from restoring net neutrality, protecting consumers' privacy&preserving local media.

So much for Eversource’s handwringing & hypocrisy about helping consumers & sacrificing revenue—$10M for consumers & almost $1.2B for themselves. We need to break up Eversource & establish a truly public utility where profits go to Main St not Wall St. ctinsider.com/business/artic…
Too many Americans are still being senselessly murdered by this scourge. No more complicity, no more excuses—Congress must act.
Unthinkable 5 years ago this day—Parkland became a real life horror, like Sandy Hook & hideous mass murders before it. Survivors & loved ones relive that tragedy every day, & their unspeakable loss.

CT has shown the way on commonsense gun violence prevention measures & we know that red flag laws can save lives. Thanks to the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act, we are able to support the implementation of these laws & encourage other states to follow suit.

This federal funding will be a critical driver to ensure states, including CT, have the necessary tools to keep firearms out of the hands of those who pose a serious threat to themselves or to others.

This $2.5 million to support our state’s red flag law is a major investment in keeping guns out of the hands of dangerous people—as I have long advocated in championing these protections nationally. Red flag laws are imperative to preventing the scourge of gun violence.

Valentine’s Day is a reminder of what love is: mutual respect, trust, healthy boundaries, honest communication. This February during Teen Dating Violence Awareness we can empower & encourage young people to establish healthy relationships.

I also feel that sense of outrage at Congressional inaction. The Kids Online Safety Act & EARN IT Act are the least we can do to help begin protecting children online—giving people the tools, transparency, & guardrails they need to take back control over their own lives.

Powerful words from today’s witnesses. Eloquent & moving advocates who are exactly right: “We’re done with the hearings, we’re done with the stories—we’re looking to you all for action. I am confident that you can all come together & do this for us & for America’s children.”
The poisonous Big Tech model—more eyeballs=more ads=more dollars, putting profits above people—can be curbed through my & @MarshaBlackburn's  Kids Online Safety Act.
Deepening depression among teens, particularly girls, heightens the urgency of protecting them against toxic content driven at them by Big Tech’s black box algorithms. nytimes.com/2023/02/13/healt…

Last Dec. a group of young people&mothers came to Congress to fight for the Kids Online Safety Act with a powerful message: “How many more children have to die before we make them a priority? Now is the time. Let’s do it. Let’s pass it.” 

Congress must heed that call, & act. 14

This mental health crisis will persist—take more young lives—until Congress cares more about kids than Big Tech. 

It is urgent for us to move the Kids Online Safety Act forward & enshrine these protections into law. 13/
But, right now, urgently, the Kids Online Safety Act can be a model for how bipartisan legislating can still work—a message to the public that Congress can still work. 12/

These powerful corporations have failed to stop the plague of child sexual exploitation infesting their platforms, while hiding behind Sec 230. 

That failure—calculated, cunning, unconscionable failure—demands changes like the EARN IT Act. 11/
Beyond any reasonable doubt, action is imperative now. There is a momentous need to reform Big Tech. 10/

After all of America has seen with our own eyes, the tragedies & dangers in our own communities & households. 

The evidence of harm is heartbreakingly abundant. 9/
After testimony from a brave whistleblower, Frances Haugen, who presented documents that Facebook calculatingly drove toxic content to draw more eyeballs, more clicks, & more advertiser dollars. 8/

After five extensive hearings last session with Sen. @MarshaBlackburn at our Consumer Protection Subcommittee. 

After deeply painful conversations with young people & parents. 7/
We must give kids & parents the tools, transparency, & guardrails they need to take back control over their lives. That is why we must—& will—double down on the Kids Online Safety Act. 6/

We face a public health imperative, not just a moral reckoning. 

Our nation is in the midst of a mental health crisis. Aggravated by toxic content & driven by Big Tech’s black box algorithms, leading children down dark rabbit holes. 5/

Outrage at inaction—Congress’ inexcusable failure to pass the Kids Online Safety Act. 


Outrage at Big Tech’s pillaging the public interest with armies of lobbyists & lawyers, despite its pledges of collaboration. 


Outrage that victims must relive their pain & grief. 4/

Parents—whose tears & raw grief as they told me about their loss—have moved me with heartbreaking power.

Young people like Emma Lembke have been victims of Big Tech’s hideous “experiment,” as President Biden rightly called it.

We grieve again—our hearts going out to victims, survivors, loved ones. We are still awaiting more facts about the shooting, but we know for sure what can be done to honor them with action. Solid steps against gun violence like Gov. Whitmer’s proposed  red flag&safe storage laws.

We can no longer rely on social media companies to police themselves. @MarshaBlackburn & my Kids Online Safety Act is necessary to give parents & young people control of the content they are consuming, ensure Big Tech accountability, & encourage greater transparency.
Social media platforms are knowingly using their black box algorithms to drive kids down dark rabbit holes. Doing so helps their bottom line—more eyes equals more dollars.

The Village in Hartford is doing so much for kids’ safety & health. I joined clinicians & child advocates today to urge swift passage of the Kids Online Safety Act–saving children from the toxic online content that threatens their lives & wellbeing.
I’ve reintroduced my Airline Passengers’ Bill of Rights to ensure consumers have the protections they deserve & to incentivize airlines to do the right thing.

Unexpected cancellations, delays, exorbitant fees, & cramped seats. These frustrations & others are all too frequent realities of flying. Air travel has never been more uncomfortable, unpredictable, or stressful. Here’s what Congress can do about it. theday.com/op-ed/20230211/ai…
A chilly Sunday morning in New Haven—no better time to support @IRISCT in its life-saving work for refugees. Proud to be at the annual Run with a warm, wonderful turnout.

Driving shouldn’t be a contact sport. Tesla’s pitches & promises for its self-driving capabilities need strong scrutiny, consumers deserve the truth. A Super Bowl ad shouldn’t be necessary to do it. washingtonpost.com/technolog…

Proud to join @rosadelauro in opening the Venture Smith exhibit in New Haven, the powerful story of this early American slave who bought his freedom in CT 258 years ago. We’re reintroducing our Resolution commemorating his courage & resilience.

India’s independence&constitutional democracy celebrated last night w/wonderful food, song&dance in Hartford at CT’s Capitol. I was proud to join in marking this historic 75th anniversary of freedom, rights&the rule of law among so many friends in the Indian-American community.

I appreciate Chair Durbin & Ranking Member Graham for convening this hearing. It is a timely opportunity to continue shining the spotlight on Big Tech’s ongoing harms to kids. The harrowing experiences of young people & families online implore Congress to swiftly act. 4

We’ll also hear about the fantastic work @MissingKids & ICAC are doing to combat CSAM online. Millions of horrifying images go unidentified & unreported by tech platforms because there are so few consequences for these companies. That ends w/@LindseyGrahamSC & my EARN IT Act. 3/

The Committee will be fortunate to hear from Kristin & Emma whose lived experiences make clear the lasting negative impact of Big Tech. Kids are being harmed by these platforms. We must pass @MarshaBlackburn & my Kids Online Safety Act to hold these companies accountable. 2/

The phenomenal witnesses set to testify before the Senate Judiciary Committee at Tuesday’s hearing are smart, compassionate online safety champions—instrumental in helping craft my comprehensive Kids Online Safety Act & EARN IT Act. 1/ judiciary.senate.gov/meeting…

Crackdown on sky-high fees—stop anti-consumer tactics like holding back tickets & require fees be “all in” with full disclosure as my BOSS Act requires. Thanks to the President for State of the Union shout out. Now Congress must act.
rollingstone.com/music/music…

What has occurred in Türkiye & Syria is a catastrophe of epic proportions. I will work & fight for any & all assistance—in medical supplies, food, shelter, clothing, & more—that are needed now in this moment of devastating disaster.

At Diyanet Mosque of New Haven people are rallying together in an outpouring of support for the victims of the earthquake in Türkiye & Syria. Bringing food, clothing, & other supplies to this wonderful place of faith & dedication.

Wheeler Clinic’s new community health center is about treatment, hope, & a brighter future. This nearly $1M federal investment will pay dividends for years to come—helping people throughout the Bristol region get the care they need & deserve.

Powerful points for my Kids Online Safety Act & other privacy reforms, already enjoying strong bipartisan support. We’re at a magic moment politically & morally—the Congressional stars aligned. We must seize it. washingtonpost.com/opinions/…
Our persistent bipartisan work—proud to say, me & @JohnCornyn—will enable more competition & innovation for prescription drugs, lowering prices. Standing up to Big Pharma, fighting for consumers.
Drug prices can be cut by stopping Big Pharma’s abuse of patents—which my Affordable Prescriptions For Patients Act will help do. It was approved unanimously by the Judiciary Committee today.

Our country is facing an at home care crisis. The failure to provide enough pay & support to long term care workers has rippling ramifications. I stand in strong solidarity with @1199SEIU as they join me in calling for passage of the Better Care Better Jobs Act.

We passed the PACT Act & now need to make sure veterans come home to good paying jobs, affordable housing, & mental health services they need & deserve. We must work together with bipartisan action to make it a reality.

I was proud of his support for continuing the progress we made last year in providing our veterans with the care & benefits when they suffer the effects of toxic chemicals from burn pits & other sources.

I was especially encouraged by his support for stopping the poisonous effect of social media. My Kids Online Safety Act is long overdue. Kids & teens are demanding tools & safeguards that allow them to take control of their online lives—& Big Tech needs to be held accountable.

Ukraine is fighting for more than its own freedom—they are on the frontlines of the global war for democracy. Ukrainians I’ve met on my visits will hear this speech & be fortified by our nation’s firm commitment to their cause.

.@POTUS’ words glowed with hope & energy in reminding us how much we can continue to accomplish when we work together. I was deeply moved by his determination & strength in urging heightened support for Ukraine against Putin’s murderous, genocidal invasion.

Our roads have never been deadlier—with injuries & fatalities at an all time high, to motorists, pedestrians & cyclists. The Bipartisan Infrastructure Act passed last session has $5B for safer roads & streets. A good beginning.

New Britain & other CT communities are making roads safer for motorists, pedestrians, & cyclists thanks to a $2.4M federal grant. With this funding from the Infrastructure Investment & Jobs Act, our state will be on the path to better roads, safer streets, & fewer injuries.

Absolutely sickening news coming from Türkiye & Syria. My thoughts are with the victims. A coalition of humanitarian aid, led by the U.S., should engage in rescue & recovery. nytimes.com/live/2023/02/05/…

Alex is a real hero. His remarkable leadership, dedication, & determination has provided a path out of Afghanistan for many of the most vulnerable & at-risk of our allies. I am honored to host him as my guest for tomorrow’s State of the Union address.

Welcome Home! Members of the 103rd Airlift Wing returning from the Horn of Africa—& congratulations on 100 years of “Flying Yankees” serving our nation. Their centennial marked by the tail flash on this C-130 aircraft. Great ceremony in East Granby.

As we begin the countdown to National Pizza Day this Thursday—with boasts & bragging about America’s best pie—no question that CT is at the top. No way I can play favorites, so many world class choices, & imitators around the country, I can hear colleagues’ stomachs growling.
Remembering the tragic loss of 6 workers in the Kleen Energy explosion at this 13th Commemoration in Middletown. The cause of workplace safety is as urgent as ever.

Insightful analysis from Yale’s soon-to-be Dean of its School of Public Health, Megan Ranney, an emergency physician & Brown educator who’s seen the savage destruction done by gun violence. CT welcomes her to our fight against this public health epidemic. washingtonpost.com/opinions/…

We’re demanding answers from the Army—why in effect it disqualified Sikorsky’s Defiant X helicopter in favor of Bell’s potentially costlier V280—after denials of information. The public deserves facts, not unnecessary secrecy. defenseone.com/policy/2023/0…

A life of service—Peter Carozza’s inspiring career in firefighting&longtime President of the Uniformed Professional Fire Fighters Association—was honored with well deserved accolades, acclaim&gratitude. He has fought for the fire service&public safety with courage&conviction.

Two members of the greatest generation—brothers Charles & William Petrone—were honored in Danbury with WWII medals. Charles was killed in action at age 19. William came home—& has lived to be close to 100. I was privileged to participate—saluting inspiring patriots & heroes.

Domestic violence survivors are less safe today because their abusers have supposed 2nd amendment rights to undermine protective orders. This 5th Circuit Appeals Court ruling is dangerous, giving abusers broad, scary legal rights. We need to fight it. washingtonpost.com/opinions/…

Safe storage, a ban on assault weapons, community violence intervention programs, strengthened red flag laws, & increased resources for law enforcement can & will save lives. I’m proud to be a founding member & will continue fighting for legislation to protect our communities.

The Gun Violence Prevention Caucus will elevate attention to our nation’s epidemic & unite colleagues devoted to a common cause. Last year’s Bipartisan Safer Communities Act was a step forward, but more must be done to prevent the needless bloodshed & loss.

Portable space heaters are great for keeping warm, but can quickly turn into dangerous fire hazards. I joined the Hamden Fire Department in calling for improved safety standards & the passage of my Safer Heat Act. Please stay safe & warm this winter.

PSI’s legacy of unsparing & relentless accountability is one that I am privileged to continue. 

To Big Tech & others in industry: you’ll be hearing from me very, very soon.

While I may no longer be serving on the Commerce Committee, my priorities remain the same: protecting Americans from exploitation, fraud, & abuse remains my driving passion. Consumers need vigorous voices & champions now more than ever.

The relationships I have forged on the Commerce Committee will continue to be some of my most valued partnerships & I look forward to pursuing bipartisan legislative proposals that my colleagues & I have introduced & advocated in the past.

Just In: I am honored to take the gavel of the Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations, which has conducted some of the most significant inquiries in the history of Congress, going after wrongdoers—no matter how powerful—in every corner of American life.

China’s excuse for its off course surveillance balloon is a lot of hot air—an insult to our intelligence, in so many ways. The response needs to be more robust than just canceling a Secretary of State visit. Call it out. Signal outrage with action. 
nytimes.com/2023/02/03/world…

As Russia ramps up its savage criminal onslaught, Ukraine’s EU membership should be fast tracked. Symbolic meetings & statements of solidarity are no substitute for real support—military or economic—by European nations. They’re next on Putin’s agenda if he wins Ukraine.

Ticketing fees have skyrocketed for concerts, sporting, & other live events. Combine that with the shortage of online ticketing options & fans are left with no good alternatives. My BOSS Act will help stop hidden fees & allow fans the chance to simply enjoy the show.

.@POTUS is right to take a stand against outrageous hidden fees that fleece Americans out of billions of dollars. Congress must take action to save Americans money & stop companies from disguising actual prices with bogus booking & ticketing fees. whitehouse.gov/briefing-room…

The servicemembers who will rely on the FLRAA deserve better. The Army must reconsider this decision & provide them the helicopter that delivers the required capability at a cost that can be sustained.
CT jobs & families are on the line with this decision & our delegation & Sikorsky’s dedicated, world class workers deserve answers. The Army’s repeated refusal to provide a briefing is unacceptable.

Despite our delegation’s repeated requests, the Army unreasonably & irresponsibly has refused to provide us—or the public—with any information about why Sikorsky’s bid to build Future Long Range Assault Aircraft was rejected. fox61.com/article/news/polit…

Teaching teens & young adults about what it means to be in a healthy relationship is fundamental to breaking the cycle of domestic violence. As we begin Teen Dating Violence Awareness Month, I encourage young people, parents, & educators to learn more: intervalhousect.org/domestic…
Has Ticketmaster learned who run the world? Girls. Beyoncé. Taylor Swift. Fans. All of us are watching. cnn.com/2023/02/01/business/…

#BlackHistoryMonth is a time to celebrate the contributions of Black leaders, activists&trailblazers who have broken barriers&fought injustice. 

We must honor&continue their work to build a more inclusive Union where equality, justice&economic opportunity are a reality for all.

The Southwest Airlines debacle is just the latest example of why we urgently need stronger passenger protections, as air travel has become more stressful, unpredictable, & uncomfortable for travelers.

My Airline Passengers’ Bill of Rights with @SenMarkey will ensure fliers have the essential consumer protections they deserve. This legislation will establish clear, enforceable rules for airlines to follow, putting travelers first & restoring sanity to the skies.

Wonderful to see long awaited improvements to the Gateway Hudson Tunnel project—an initiative I’ve long supported—coming to fruition. Modernizing this rail link will be vital to reducing trip times & making CT & New England more accessible.

Through their tireless work, Kristin & Mike Song have been the face of courage & resilience—turning their grief into action. Their advocacy has saved lives across CT, & passing this legislation will save lives across the country.

No one should have to face the unimaginable grief of losing a loved one because of an unsecured firearm. Under Ethan’s Law—which I’m reintroducing today—responsible safe storage requirements will help prevent these senseless, unnecessary deaths.

More federal money for the SNAP program & child nutrition is an investment in the future of our families & young people. We will not stand by as people in CT face hunger. I will continue to fight at the federal level for food security & increased funds.
These appalling attacks must be condemned. We seek to stop spiraling violence & hate, which only beget tragedy. I will continue to condemn violence & hope for peace.

Anger & grief are rightly & widely shared in the wake of 2 terrorist attacks last Friday—most especially the barbaric murder of 7 innocent people outside a synagogue in Jerusalem. Committed almost immediately after our marking International Holocaust Remembrance Day.
A pillar of the Darien community, Charlie Saverine leaves behind a beautiful family & many friends & admirers. As an athlete, mentor, & public servant, his legacy will be enduring. One of a kind.

Looking forward to seeing John—a longtime friend from his road races I’ve run—back in action. Make no mistake: With Gaylord’s help, he’ll be on his bike again in record time. A man of boundless grit & grace.

John Bysiewicz is a hero—recovering with absolutely inspiring resolve & courage from a tragic biking crash caused by an impaired car driver. His wonderful family is his rock. Great Gaylord caregivers are rock stars.

Powerful, moving rally in memory of Tyre Nichols at Summerfield United Methodist Church in Bridgeport led by Pastor & state Senator Herron Gaston. Cries for justice call on the conscience of our country & Congress after acts of hideous, inhuman brutality.

The Army got this one wrong. Our nation deserves the best helicopters & @Sikorsky’s world class, highly skilled workforce makes them. The Army scraping decades of experience for an inferior, massively more expensive product must be reversed.

Honored to attend U.S. Coast Guard Academy event honoring trailblazing women SPARS (Semper Paratus, Always Ready) who served during WWII. Women are part of USCG’s inspiring history—& future—of service & sacrifice. We’re championing a new museum to salute it.
Stomach turning & heartbreaking, we cannot turn away from Tyre Nichols’ brutal death. His family, community, all America demand & deserve justice.

Assault weapons—built for the battlefield & designed to maximize destruction—have brought bloodshed & carnage to our communities. Advocates, @ChrisMurphyCT, & I stand together today to make clear that now is the time for Congress to curtail access to these weapons of war.

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we honor the six million Jews & millions of others that were systematically murdered by the Nazis. As we face rising levels of hate & anti-Semitism, we must commit to speaking out against bigotry & hate each & every day. #NeverForget

Constance Baker Motley was a true trailblazer, a spectacular legal mind & hero of the courts. I’ll be reintroducing my bill to honor this native of New Haven with the Congressional Gold Medal—a recognition she deeply deserves.

Consumers deserve clear, concise information on food packaging so they can make healthy choices. 

Glad to see the FDA moving forward with the development of a standardized, science-based front-of-package labeling system—improvements I’ve long called for.

Now that the tank decision has finally been made it must be executed without delay—right now. Wasted time will cost lives, & strategic strength. Russia is amassing troops & arms for its offensive—tank training & transfers must begin immediately, not months away.

Hearing of action that breaks the logjam on tanks for Ukraine, I thought back to our meeting with @ZelenskyyUa last week during our visit to Kyiv. He told us the lifesaving difference the tanks will make.

Significant, strong show of support for Ukraine. American Abrams tanks will be instrumental in the spring offensive against Putin’s barbaric assault. With the proper military weaponry & Ukrainian’s dogged determination, they can—& will—win.

Over $243,000 in federal grants for The Connection will help to support their comprehensive, prevention-orientated approach to address our state’s opioid & mental health crises. Their work is truly a force multiplier for good in our community.

We cannot stay silent as millions of women have their reproductive freedom ripped away. Senate Democrats will keep defending against Republicans’ efforts to control, criminalize, & dehumanize women’s personal decisions about their own bodies.
Ticketmaster ought to look in the mirror & say “I’m the problem. It’s me.”
Ukraine can & will win this fight against Putin’s barbaric, genocidal invasion if it has the arms & artillery it needs. The time is now for unwavering, united support.

Today I joined members of CT’s Ukrainian community to discuss my recent bipartisan trip to Ukraine. This war is approaching a turning point. Ukraine must be given the tools it needs to defend itself against the impending assault & push back.

Safe staffing saves lives. Patients can only receive the best care possible when nurses are able to safely do their jobs. We need to treat our nurses & health care workers like the heroes they are by giving them the respect & decency they deserve.
I’m increasingly encouraged that America & Germany can break the logjam on tanks for Ukraine, but there’s a larger issue. Allied indecisions squander precious time & embolden Putin.

Germany encouragingly is inching closer to the right outcome—green lighting Leopard 2 tanks from allies & sending theirs. Thanks President Biden for keeping heat on them & promising arms—whatever Ukraine needs. bbc.com/news/world-europe-64…

Another community shattered&lives tragically cut short by gun violence— a shocking call to action for the new Congress. The Senate comes back to senseless, preventable carnage—that must be countered. My heart goes out to loved ones&survivors, but thoughts&prayers are not enough.

.@POTUS says, “Ukraine is going to get all the help they need.” @SenWhitehouse, @LindseyGrahamSC, & I couldn’t agree more. On our recent trip to Ukraine we saw the urgent need for America’s unwavering support.

As we approach the anniversary of this war, America must provide Ukraine with the military equipment, tanks, long range artillery, Patriot missiles, & more that they need.

Putin—a clear war criminal—& his allies must also be held accountable for their brutal, barbarous cruelty.

America has the historic opportunity to continue to aid Ukraine on its path to victory. The equipment we've provided has been used effectively & powerfully. So ingeniously & inventively in fact that Ukrainians are outperforming every prediction.
Time isn’t on our side. The Russians are not pausing for debate. They are rearming, reinforcing, resupplying, & preparing for a tremendous counter offensive that will be just as barbaric & inhumane.

My heart soars with hope & confidence. I am so deeply inspired by the resolve & resilience of the people of Ukraine, but I am also deeply concerned. We are at a critical turning point in this conflict. A moment of danger & massive opportunity.

.@LindseyGrahamSC, @SenWhitehouse, & I have met with @ZelenskyyUa & his top military team. Our trip to Ukraine shows that Republicans & Democrats are standing strongly together to give our wholehearted, steadfast support to Ukraine.

Time for renewed Congressional initiative on workforce investment to serve defense production. Apprenticeship programs at Electric Boat are an example, supported by an amendment in the NDAA, but only a start.

Scaling & building up our skilled defense workforce—modeled on Electric Boat—may be America’s most neglected national security challenge. We can’t make enough subs, or Patriot air defense, advanced tanks, & artillery, without investments in training the people who make them.
Kristin & Michael Song are the face of courage & resilience. I am in awe of them & their tireless work to turn grief into action. Ethan’s Law must be passed.

Thousands of children live in homes with unsecured guns. These kids are at risk of intentional & unintentional shootings. Ethan’s Law—named after Ethan Song who tragically lost his life to an unsafely stored firearm—will help prevent these senseless & unnecessary deaths.

Parents need to be aware of the dangers of edibles & how to protect their children. These poisonings are exploding in numbers—& every one is largely preventable with the right precautions & parental vigilance.

.@uconnhealth, @AGWilliamTong, CT Poison Control, & I teamed up to raise awareness of the dangers improperly stored cannabis edibles pose to children. Kids, who don’t know the difference between these products & popular candies, can be harmed when they ingest them.

Residents & businesses in Hartford’s North End are plagued by chronic flooding, water backups in basements, & other costly consequences of a failed water disposal system. I listened yesterday & will seek solutions from federal EPA & state & local agencies.
A new water pump for Stonington with $720,000 in federal money will help keep contamination out of the Paucatuck River & Long Island Sound. A strong investment for the entire SE CT region.

Bethel’s $2.24 million federal grant for two water treatment system upgrades will bring its water system into the 21st century. Glad to join local leaders to announce this funding & recognize their productive action.

Firearms fatalities to law enforcement continue at tragically high rates—chilling evidence of deadly gun risk to police & others who protect us. They deserve better protection too. Let’s stop the scourge of gun violence. nleomf.org/2022-law-enforcem…

In Norwich, the NAACP 38th Annual Freedom March was warm-hearted despite the cold—reflecting MLK’s famous remark, “I have decided to stick with love… Hate is too great a burden to bear.” Prayers & poetry were powerful.

At the Capitol, I was proud to ring CT’s Liberty Bell at noon, an annual reminder of our common obligation to bend the moral arc of the universe toward justice. Thank you to the CT MLK Day Commission for another memorable program with extraordinary honorees.

In West Hartford, student essays & musical performances—capturing the meaning of MLK for America’s future—were a highlight. Their dedication to the fight for social justice is unquenchable & galvanizing.

In Hartford, Delta Sigma Theta came back after a pandemic hiatus bigger & stronger than ever with its scholarship breakfast—filling the CT Convention Center ballroom. Celebrating MLK with pride & commitment to the ideals he embodied.

In Meriden, the Scholarship Breakfast honoring Dr. King & Albert Owens drew record numbers & tremendous spirit at Francis T. Maloney High School. Thank you once again Rhudean Raye & all who helped organize it.
#MLKDay events were uplifting & inspiring as CT movingly marked the life & legacy of this iconic leader. Common to all were powerful tributes & testaments to his call to action for justice.

Celebrating the iconic life & legacy Martin Luther King Jr., we’re inspired by his soaring oratory & unshakable courage in fighting for justice & freedom. His leadership by example has large & lasting lessons for today. The fight is no less urgent & real.

At the Revival Church in Hamden, powerful messages about action&activism in the fight for social justice from Bishop Daniel Bland&beautiful, eloquent young people. Thanks to Mayor Garrett&her Hamden Black History Committee, as well as clergy&community leaders, honoring MLK.

Stirring service at East End Baptist Tabernacle Church in Bridgeport recalling the courage, conscience, & conviction of Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King. Thank you Rev. Dr. Charles Stallworth for your leadership, & to the congregation for your wonderfully warm welcome.

Strong step by ATF on gun safety with its new final rule cracking down on accessories that make short barreled semiautomatic weapons more lethal. Stabilizing braces convert pistols to long rifles & they should be treated that way by ATF. Bravo for this critical life-saving move.

Beautiful tributes in music & memories to Quentin “Q“ Williams, a Middletown state legislator whose life was cut short tragically just a day after his swearing-in to a new term. The church service eloquently captured his life & legacy, both large & lasting.

More than 30 wonderful new citizens take the oath in New Haven’s federal courthouse today—another Immigration & Naturalization ceremony marked by joy & pride. We are a nation of immigrants—the greatest nation in the world.
In Norwich, 8th grade MLK scholars spoke eloquently about his life & legacy—proud & powerful. Grateful to be at Norwich Free Academy for this moving testament to freedom & opportunity.

A $2 million grant to Our Piece of the Pie means skills, jobs, & careers for 100’s more Hartford youth. This investment in justice involved young people provides a positive path forward, away from harm.

Ukraine needs & deserves Abrams tanks—our best—along with longer range artillery, more air defense Patriot systems, jet fighters, & more. Hesitating now means emboldening Putin’s most viscous advisers.

Deeply impressed by The Haven—Mercy Housing’s newest young adult living program in Hartford. Comfortable living, excellent staff, essential supportive services—all make this facility a welcoming, worthwhile transition space as young people find their place in the world.

Exciting day at the Waterbury-Oxford Airport as Tradewind Aviation cuts the ribbon for 20 new PC-12 NGX planes, serving charters & scheduled flights around New England & beyond. Their fleet will create high skill jobs & attract new businesses. The Zipkin family knows how to fly.
The Registry will enable better prevention, diagnosis, & care for these heroes. There is no question we must reauthorize the registry & increase resources.

Proud to stand with New Haven firefighters today to announce a near doubling in federal funds for the Firefighter Cancer Registry. Cancer is the number one cause of firefighters’ death in the line of duty—because of all the toxic chemicals they ingest or inhale.

No better use of federal infrastructure funds than vital upgrades to Rt 8 between Shelton & Seymour—a key heavily traveled artery. In fact a more than $60 million federal investment, announced today, will enable improved paving, lighting, access, & other improvements.

This is a basic need & LIHEAP is the ultimate safety net for those struggling to make ends meet.  In the recent Omnibus we secured $5 billion for LIHEAP, which will bring tens of millions of dollars back to CT families.

No family should have to choose between heating & eating. Expanded federal heating assistance funds are more vital than ever—with a 27% increase in LIHEAP applications & rising fuel prices. I announced an additional $5B on the way—with @GovNedLamont—as part of the budget package.

A solemn, deeply sad procession at the state Capitol to salute state Rep Quentin "Q" Williams, a beautiful life cut short, a brilliant light extinguished. Thank you to his wonderful family for sharing him.

Impressive business community at the Norwalk Chamber of Commerce breakfast this morning—hosted by Rich Cunningham head of Ed’s Garage Doors, a great & growing business. I’m hoping to be invited to a few garage door openings.

I presented a high school diploma to Christian Kosovic, whose family came to me 10 yrs ago when he was battling leukemia with Methotrexate treatment—which the manufacturer said it would cease making. We helped get him the drug, & now he’s bound for college. Congratulations!
The Kids Online Safety Act, Open App Markets Act & EARN IT Act will restore accountability & protect consumers & competition. I'm all in, @POTUS—Congressional action is overdue.

The President & I agree the time for tech accountability is now. Big Tech is harming our kids, violating privacy, & undermining competition with no real ramifications or consequences. wsj.com/articles/unite-again…

Wethersfield’s firefighters—the oldest volunteer fire service in New England—need more breathing protective units. To buy 68 new ones, I announced a $384,045 federal grant yesterday. Very excited, & very thankful, to be with these heroic first responders.

Chronic fatigue, headaches, shortness of breath, blood clots, & worse—all symptoms of Long COVID, suffered by up to 30% of all who test COVID positive. It’s costly & deadly, which is why we need more treatment & research money like the federal $10 million I announced today.

On this fifth anniversary of Morad Tahbaz’s inhumane, unconscionable detention by Iran, global outrage continues to grow. Grievously ill & indisputably innocent, Morad must be reunited with his family. Iran: free him, now.

These deadly, dangerous sleepers should have been removed long ago from Facebook & other marketplaces—as @janschakowsky & I demanded. Disgraceful inaction puts kids at persistent peril & unsuspecting parents at potential grief. 

blumenthal.senate.gov/newsro…
Tragic & shameful. Despite a recall, more infant deaths have been linked to the Fisher-Price Rock 'n Play & Kids2 Sleepers.

If you haven't tried Foxon Park sodas, you’re missing something special. This iconic 100-year-old CT family business, owned & operated by a fourth generation, is an inspiring American success story. White Birch is the best seller, among many flavors. All go great with pizza.

This new Recovery & Wellness Center at the Cornell Scott Hill Health Center in New Haven will save lives in the midst of a substance use disorder epidemic. I’m proud to announce a $650,000 federal grant supporting it—& look forward to the ribbon cutting.

Celebrating this day 235 years ago when Connecticut became the fifth state to join the union. The Constitution State has been an arsenal of democracy—defining & defending our nation’s ideals & freedoms.

This Wednesday, my Hartford office is teaming up with the CT Passport Agency to help constituents with passport renewals & first-time applications. Required documents & fees are below. Walk-ins are welcome!

Powerful celebration of Martin Luther King Jr.'s life & legacy thanks to Carroll E. Brown & the West Haven Black Coalition. Music, tribute, & prayer to honor Dr. King & the fight for social justice we must carry on.

Stirring tribute by Pastor & State Senator Herron Gaston to his fraternity brother & legislative colleague Quentin “Q” Williams at the Summerfield Congregational Church yesterday. A life tragically cut short.

Fans of Taylor Swift & other artists are telling me Congress ought to agree—if on nothing else—to hold Ticketmaster accountable, call top execs to a hearing, & give others a chance to speak about necessary reforms. This behemoth is exploiting artists, fans, & venues.

Joyous 3 Kings celebration at Casa Otonal in New Haven sponsored by wonderful Puerto Rican community groups, including the Ricardo Torres Jr. Memorial Scholarship Fund led by his widow Erica and mom Cathy. Proud to stand with them, remembering this heroic firefighter’s sacrifice.

What’s now happening—unimaginable, unspeakable horror—reflects a spreading gun violence cancer. No one can doubt this shooting by a 6-year-old could have been prevented. No one can justify inaction to the gravely wounded teacher. Our hearts go out to all.

Northwest CT activists are heroically stepping up to save lives—providing shelter at the Winsted Health Center to homeless families in desperate need. Heightened federal action must meet the moment—a national housing crisis. The current federal commitment is just the beginning.

Proud to join AAA in honoring Cindy Iodice & championing a bipartisan Senate Resolution on Slow Down, Move Over in memory of her brother Corey, a tow truck operator struck & killed by a drunk driver while doing his job. She’s saving lives.

Slow Down, Move Over laws help protect police, firefighters, & all who help motorists after highway crashes or breakdowns—but drivers all too often disregard these laws. That’s why Cindy Iodice’s work is critical.

If you’re stuck or stranded on a highway, you need help from a first responder or tow truck operator—& they need protection from cars speeding past, dangerously close, that should slow down & move over.

Great news—President Biden just signed my bipartisan Food Donation Improvement Act into law.

Stopping hunger should be a national priority. This legislation will remove legal barriers & promote more direct donations by restaurants, supermarkets, & others to individuals in need.

Recent passage of the Electoral Count Reform Act by Congress was a major step forward, but more must be done to improve election infrastructure, safeguard voting, protect poll workers from threats & violence, & hold those wrongdoers accountable.

Today’s a reminder of how fragile our democracy really is. We almost lost our democracy two years ago but for the bravery & courage of Capitol Police, DC Metro Police, the National Guard, & all who came to the rescue that day.
Today we relive the horror, tragedy, & trauma of January 6th. I remember the evacuation from the Senate Floor, the sounds of the attack, & the sight of the mob through the windows.

Peloton & other companies must not be allowed to cover up injuries & deaths—we must remove constraints on the CPSC’s ability to warn consumers through my Sunshine in Product Safety Act & raise the penalties for corporate misconduct.

CPSC’s $19 million fine against Peloton—after their obstruction & delays on warnings about deadly risks of their treadmills, including the death of a child—is an important step, but also an urgent call to empower & embolden our consumer protection agencies.

Thrilled to join the 50th anniversary celebration of Fire Equipment Headquarters in Torrington—a wonderful family-owned & operated small business at the forefront of preventing & fighting fires. Their incredible staff & services are saving lives.
We’re with you, Bob. Sending best wishes for a full, speedy recovery to you & your family.
A truly tragic loss for the Williams family & for our state. A young, bright life gone too early. My deepest condolences to Q’s friends, family, & loved ones.
Rebuilding this bridge is a matter of national security—allowing Electric Boat employees to get to work & helping our trucks transport supplies. Thanks to @USDOT for their leadership.

A banner day for CT as @SecretaryPete visits to announce $158 million in federal funding to continue rebuilding the Gold Star Memorial Bridge, a vital linchpin. It’s a tribute to CT workers—like building trades, iron workers, truck drivers—& unions that represent & train them.
Swearing-in of @GovNedLamont & his team—a wonderful celebration of democracy & peaceful transition of power in “The Land of Steady Habits.” I wish DC were more like it.
Exciting, energetic start to the state legislative session today—proud & delighted to see old & new friends, who give so much to CT.

My third swearing-in was no less thrilling & inspiring than the first. A spine-tingling sense of history, of immense opportunity & deep obligation. Along with Cynthia & our family, I feel blessed & grateful.
With a split Congress, progress will be more difficult to achieve, but that only means we will work harder & seek common ground while fighting for our values.

I'm deeply honored to continue serving the people of CT for a 3rd term. We'll build on past accomplishments & continue to help all Americans to thrive in safe, affordable communities, protect the environment, strengthen national defense, & provide more economic opportunity.

Congratulations to new New Haven Probate Court Judge Americo Carchia whose swearing-in I attended proudly yesterday. In this profoundly important & powerful position of trust he’ll be helping people when they need it most with humanity & justice.
Calling hours for Matthias Wirtz, heroic North Haven firefighter, brought out mourners from all over CT, as well as professional brothers & sisters. Their love & respect is deeply inspiring.
Under my Airline Passenger Bill of Rights, Airline travel reliability wouldn’t be up in the air. Passengers need access to courts & class actions—enforcement is essential.
Airline passengers deserve complete compensation for all delayed or cancelled flights, full refunds for expenses, no more nickel & dime charges & fees, & other basic rights.
The Southwest Airlines meltdown shows again why travelers need protection—an Airline Passengers Bill of Rights with ironclad, fully enforceable remedies for rampant failings.
Citizens are terrified of being shot while grocery shopping or attending church. Parents worry about raising children who won’t be able to breathe clean air or drink clean water.
After recent Court decisions, women live in fear of getting pregnant & dying because they can’t receive medical care.
This Court repeatedly & cavalierly upends settled law to rip away cherished & long-held constitutional rights & freedoms.

Failure to address these problems, coupled w/extremist, activist opinions, will lead to continued declines in the Court’s credibility. Congress must pass financial disclosure requirements for SCOTUS & help prevent conflicts of interest that he ignores. There’s bipartisan support.

The Chief Justice’s “hear no evil, see no evil” Annual Report is a huge missed opportunity—ducking key institutional problems at SCOTUS like glaring conflicts of interest, leaked draft opinions, & inappropriate speeches. wsj.com/articles/supreme-cou…
A wonderful #NewYear to all! As we ring in 2023, I’m more grateful than ever to serve the people of CT & fight for a better, healthier, safer tomorrow.
